summary: Entrepreneur, speaker, ideator & thinker bringing the fractional & decentralized leadership model into the future of work. I‚Äôm a Fractional Futurist, helping fractional executives build million-dollar firms they can scale and eventually exit. Going from 0‚Äì1 is hard. Shifting from freelancer to founder is harder. That‚Äôs where I come in‚Äîwith strategy, structure, and the FROST Framework. I‚Äôm the co-founder of yorCMO, the first decentralized leadership franchise for fractional CMOs. And now, I‚Äôm scaling FractionalPros.com, a platform that connects SMBs with vetted fractional leaders‚Äîand helps those leaders find visibility, leads, and community through niche-driven peer pods. I believe in decentralized teams, strategic clarity, and the idea that every expert deserves a business model that works for them, not just because of them. I‚Äôve had a non-linear career and life. I‚Äôve: - Started a lawn care service in high school and sold the business before college - Studied and worked in chemical engineering - Founded 4 companies: from mortgage financing to media to data haptics tech - Published and written a book on media habits - Taught Entrepreneurship to university students - Created a documentary film on the seasons of entrepreneurship - Launched a community for fractional pros I spent years attempting to reconcile my wildly diverse experiences, let alone trying to explain them to those around me. Eventually, I realized that my decentralized nature was an asset: I could help other entrepreneurs engineer non-traditional, weird, unexpected and creative ideas into their businesses. Often it‚Äôs the simplest ideas that have the power to make a big impact & combust at scale. Board Member at Entrepreneurs‚Äô Organization (EO) Nebraska. I am also the host of a weekly podcast ‚ÄúThe Fractional C-Suite Retreat‚Äù featuring thought leaders on the future of work in the C-Suite. By day, professional tea and coffee drinker; by night, cigar enthusiast and living my best life with my wife and 4 children. Reach out to me for: ‚úîÔ∏è Discussions on how to leverage the power of fractional executive leaders in your business ‚úîÔ∏è Keynotes, talks & panel discussions on the fractional future of work ‚úîÔ∏è Good conversation over a cigar üìß joseph@yorcmo.com
job description: Do you have marketing PTSD? Looking for someone you can trust to lead your marketing efforts, to build and execute a strategic marketing plan aligned to your sales and growth goals? Is your business looking to pivot, scale, or exit? Do you need marketing expertise on your leadership team? Are you tired of spending money on marketing and not seeing sales results? We promise way better marketing with our fractional marketing approach at yorCMO. We connect you with an unbiased marketing expert - yorCMO - and begin with a marketing audit to establish your baseline. Then we build your marketing strategy during our foundation sessions, and finally we help you and your team execute with our quarterly action sessions and weekly check-ins. We are your outsourced or fractional Chief Marketing Officer - yorCMO.
linkedin description: Every business wants to grow, but far too many of them waste money on disorganized marketing tactics and strategies that, in the end, don‚Äôt support that goal. At yorCMO, we believe getting clear about your marketing goals and tactics is essential to your business‚Äôs success. Our goal is to help growth-minded CEOs gain someone they can trust to execute their marketing better than they are currently. Since 2016, we‚Äôve built a growing team of fractional CMOs, exclusively limited to those with decades of experience and proven leadership in various industries. As part of the yorCMO proven process, your CMO becomes a fiduciary partner, building your customized strategy and executing it in a way that drives up sales, without wasting any more of your time or money. But our work could never be possible by simply remaining in the ‚Äúoutsider‚Äù role that is so common among marketing consultants, agencies, and vendors. That‚Äôs why when you partner with us, we‚Äôre more than a consultant. We‚Äôre on your team‚Äí but for a fraction of the cost of adding on another full-time employee. Our results-driven fractional CMO model is designed to allow us to integrate with your existing team so that you get the customized solutions, C-Level expertise, and proven process you need. It‚Äôs a model designed around our belief that ‚Äúyour success is our success,‚Äù and we are uncommonly committed to your success. Schedule a free consultation with our team today and stop wasting time and money on ineffective tactics and start growing your business with confidence and competence: info@yorcmo.com | www.yorcmo.com

summary: AI is flattening organizations faster than most leaders can adapt. Skilled managers are downsized. Layers are shrinking. Work is speeding up. And leadership models built on control and hierarchy are breaking down. I provide architecture that makes teams self-managing for Fractionals, Business Owners, Consultants and Coaches. Leaders and HR partners tell me the same thing: ‚ÄúWe know collaboration matters‚Äîbut we can‚Äôt measure it, sustain it, or scale it.‚Äù That‚Äôs where the TIGERS¬Æ 6 Principles System comes in. It equips leaders and HR partners to turn AI-driven flattening into a human advantage through measurable trust, collaboration, and engagement. For more than 30 years, I‚Äôve helped organizations‚Äîfrom Fortune 500s to nonprofits‚Äîcreate high-trust, self-aligning cultures that thrive in complexity. The TIGERS System builds six measurable principles that drive collaboration: Trust | Interdependence | Genuineness | Empathy | Risk Resolution | Success. These aren‚Äôt soft skills. They‚Äôre behavioral metrics that leaders can observe, measure, and scale. That‚Äôs why we license this framework to coaches, consultants, and HR partners who want to deliver sustainable, people-centered transformation that makes work easier not harder. When trust becomes measurable, transformation becomes unstoppable. If you‚Äôre ready to future-proof your leadership in an AI-flattened world, connect with me here and explore TIGERS6Principles.com Available case studies: Case Study: Costco Corporation. summary: My journey's been quite a ride: from an Army brat to Military Police, then a police officer, paramedic, Navy spouse, and a business owner for 30 years. All those experiences gave me a unique lens for navigating life's big challenges. And my military dad? He taught me that your word is everything, period. That's always been my North Star. Then came the moment that changed everything. After my husband, Jim, passed away, I found myself in a really vulnerable spot, something I never expected despite my business success. That feeling was a huge wake-up call. I just refused to let anyone else go through that, so I dug in and mastered how to build lasting stability and well-being. My friends say I'm stubborn about everything, and hey, they're not wrong! For over 20 years, I've had the incredible privilege of helping hundreds of families and thousands of folks become their most resilient selves. My passion is empowering the people who truly keep our country going‚Äîveterans, folks in rural America, farmers, truckers, and entrepreneurs. I love taking complicated stuff and making it simple, helping people really step into their power. My approach is pretty straightforward: think strategically, make smart choices, and use what you've got effectively. My biggest tip? Consistent, focused effort really does pay off big time in the long run. With six generations of military service in my family, helping those who've served is deeply personal for me. And living out here in rural America, I'm constantly working to help our communities find their footing and build a strong future, generation after generation. You know that saying, "you are who you spend time with"? That totally changed how I connect with people. I love bringing clients, experts, and executives together because I really get what makes them tick‚Äîtheir challenges, their dreams, all of it. When I'm not busy helping people create brighter futures, you'll find me on my farm, training horses and dogs. Oh, and get this: at 60, I'm on zero meds and can deadlift almost 300 pounds! It just goes to show you that the same rules apply whether you're building a strong life or a strong body: ditch what doesn't serve you, stay consistent, and nail the basics. That... is the new art of living.

I helped people with budgeting when I was young and learned that a simple change could make a huge impact. While I was a Navy Spouse, I started and grew several businesses... job description (4): Serving on the board of Fashion Takes Action, a nonprofit advancing sustainability, ethics, and circularity in the fashion industry. I contribute my expertise in leadership, strategy, and social impact to support FTA‚Äôs mission of driving systems change and creating a more responsible fashion future.
linkedin description (4): Our mission is to advance sustainability in the entire fashion system through education, awareness, research and collaboration. Since 2007 we have worked with more than 800 brands, designers and retailers, participated in over 300 events, and reached millions of citizens through social and earned media as well as hundreds of speaking engagements. We are leading a research study with the Canadian Ministry of Environment & Climate Change on textile recycling and will produce a roadmap for industry; we convened the Ontario Textile Diversion Collaborative for 3 years in an effort to get textiles out of the landfill; we produce the annual WEAR conference (since 2014) and in 2019 we created a Sustainable Fashion Toolkit in partnership with PwC. Our role is to identify barriers to sustainability and do what we can to remove them. At FTA, we are also continually engaging the consumer - not just about how or where to shop but about so much more: reducing consumption, keeping clothes in use for longer, swapping, donating unwanted textiles, how to launder and take better care for your clothes, buying quality over quantity, supporting local businesses, buying fair trade garments, understanding the social and environmental impacts of fashion - from the amount of water, toxic chemicals and energy required to make our clothing, to fair labour, wages and working conditions. We also highlight the leaders who are working to solve these complicated problems. Our youth education program, My Clothes My World, has been delivered to more than 20,000 students in grades 4-12 across Ontario and now in Vancouver. Our in person and digital workshops provide interactive activities that elicit discussions around labour rights, consumerism and environmental degradation. It opens the students'‚Äã eyes to the truth about the apparel industry and inspires them to take meaningful action.
linkedin specialities (4): Stakeholder Engagement, Youth Education, Industry Conference, Circular Fashion, Ethical Fashion, Sustainable Fashion Toolkit, WEAR Conference, Textile Recycling, 7 R's of Fashion, Removing Barriers, Research, Cross Sector Collaboration, Global Partnerships

summary: From a young age, I‚Äôve had an innate desire to help people. Whether it was identifying problems when no one else was looking, asking the probing questions that every parent dreads, or offering solutions‚Äîsometimes unsolicited‚ÄîI was always driven to make things better. If you had asked me what I wanted to be when I grew up, my answers would have included lawyer, police officer, or doctor. As I got older, I knew those weren't right for me. My career journey has taken me through various sectors, including small to medium-sized businesses, the service industry, a lobbying firm in Washington D.C., a mega-church, and local government. In each organization, I consistently sought to understand the challenges at hand. I asked questions, identified issues, and proposed solutions‚Äîsome welcomed, others less so. Regardless of the setting, my focus remained on finding the most strategic and logical paths forward. This involved refining existing processes and systems. One recurring theme across all these organizations was a lack of clarity in management and leadership. Employees often struggled with unclear expectations, resulting in low morale and plenty of ‚Äúwater cooler‚Äù conversations post-meetings. Furthermore, genuine people development was frequently overlooked. Through my diverse work experiences and education, I discovered the sweet spot where my skills and passions intersected. Today, I have the privilege of helping businesses transform their operations and cultures. I collaborate closely with business owners to diagnose their challenges and craft tailored growth strategies. The best part? They define what success looks like for them, and together we build a roadmap to achieve it. Are You Facing These Challenges? ‚è© Is your business growing but you're unsure how to sustain that momentum? ‚è© Is your team not performing at the level you know they can? ‚è© Are you bogged down by a lack of clarity and ineffective processes that hinder your growth? ‚è© Are you tired of feeling overwhelmed as a business owner or CEO and longing for more balance in your life? If you answered "yes" to any of these questions, I want to invite you into a conversation. This initial conversation will help us diagnose the issues within your business and identify actionable strategies you can implement right away. For more information or to schedule your meeting, contact me at: üìß stephanie@germanbusinessconsulting.com üìÖhttps://link.acceleratemybiz.com/widget/booking/VwJ3eg82LY2ZrscVUuPf Together, we can create a business that you love.
company: Fresno County Women's Chamber of Commerce
linkedin description: The Fresno County Women‚Äôs Chamber of Commerce was originally established as a committee within an organization. Women served on some committees but, were not allowed to hold office and did not have voting privileges. Because women were paid lower salaries in those days, most women could not afford to join the Greater Fresno Area Chamber of Commerce. In 1950, that all changed. Martha McKinley received permission from the President of the Chamber to form a ‚ÄúWomen‚Äôs Section‚Äù, with dues more affordable to the working women of that time. They were to have their own Officers and Bylaws. For the next 40 years, the Women‚Äôs Section acted as a support group for the Chamber. In 1990 it was time for a change and thus evolved the Fresno County Women‚Äôs Chamber of Commerce, a 501(c)(6) organization. Our mission is to provide and promote professional opportunities, personal development, financial growth, community leadership and legislative awareness for women. We believe in supporting each other and watching our members‚Äô successes. By encouraging others to do business with fellow members, members see their business and friendships grow. Inspiring you: To think differently To discover something new To meet new people To play a greater role in our community To discover new ways to help your business grow
job description (2): All businesses hit bumps in the road or come across bottlenecks. These are the things that stop you from moving your business forward. Sometimes this is around processes, sometimes around marketing or your funnel, sometimes this is around the way the organization is structured, and sometimes it is a management/leadership issue. The reality is, processes and people have an impact on the profit in your business. I help small to medium size businesses strategically increase their leads, sales, and revenue. We work together to discover what is holding you back from making the revenue you want in your business, establishing a plan, and then execute it. I also help turn managers into leaders. There is a difference in the two and once a manager starts acting as a leader, the organization will begin to see an increase in productivity, employee engagement, and profits. Discover your preferred leadership style, how to motivate employees, discover how your core values relate to your leadership values and your organization, and make a bigger impact in your organization. job description (3): Available at: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07YXF7RKQ Anyone can be a boss. It takes a true servant to be a leader. The success of any organization and its people depends on the type of leader you choose to be. Stephanie German, leadership coach and speaker, succinctly dissects what it takes to become a leader worth following. Maybe you‚Äôve heard these phrases from your own boss: ‚ÄúWell, I‚Äôm the boss so I‚Äôm going to do what I want.‚Äù ‚ÄúI‚Äôm the boss and get to make the final decision.‚Äù ‚ÄúThis is how it‚Äôs going to be done‚Äîno questions.‚Äù If those words sound familiar, then realize that you‚Äôre not alone. This book is designed to help you navigate your own leadership journey so you can become the boss you‚Äôve always wanted to be. Stephanie German teaches you how to: Find your strengths as a leader Learn how to delegate others Lead people with their particular personality in mind Communicate effectively with your employees Act like a leader, not a manager What if you actually did what you thought was right and not whatever it took to meet deadlines? What if you learned a better way to lead people? And what if that style of leadership made everyone more successful? So Your Boss Can‚Äôt Lead? transforms leaders into great ones. From crafting a vision statement of your core values to examining the differences between management and leadership, you‚Äôll finish this concise book with a plan in place to demonstrate servant leadership instead of micromanagement. Are you ready to establish trust with your employees, communicate an organization‚Äôs vision, and build up new leaders in the process?

education school linkedin description (3: Known as ‚ÄúThe JC‚Äù, New Mexico Junior College was the first junior college founded in New Mexico after the legislature in Santa Fe passed the 1963 Junior College Act. Established in 1965, the college first opened its doors to students in the fall of 1966. Since that time, the JC has become a leader in innovative educational programs, dual credit education for area high school students, industrial and professional workforce training, and a critical player in the economy of the region. Situated on 219 acres, the college has over 637,000 gross square feet of building space with an enrollment of about 3,000 students. Students can receive an Associates of Arts, and Associates of Science, and an Associates of Applied Science, with an emphasis in several fields, plus we offer occupational certificate programs that provide a course of study preparing students directly for employment or self-employment upon completion of the program. Long a leader in dual credit education, well before the term was widely recognized, NMJC and area high schools have evolved a best practice model of dual credit and on campus career technical training courses that regularly results in high school seniors walking for their high school diploma and two-year degree in the same week. As an early adopter of distance education technology, NMJC provides a wide range of educational opportunities to students throughout the region and nation. Roughly one-third of NMJC student credit hours are produced in an online-learning environment. In workforce training and professional development, The JC provided more workforce training in 2014 for area residents and businesses than any other community college in New Mexico, despite the fact that its rural area is significantly smaller than the large metropolitan areas of the state. NMJC is a national leader in energy education and training. Serving an area of the country known as the Permian Basin, The JC has developed one of the first comprehensive oil field training facilities in the nation. In addition, the recent expansion of the nuclear industry in the region has driven development of a robust online training program for nuclear technicians. With support from the Nuclear Regulatory Commission and Lockheed Martin, The JC has become the college-of-choice for technical training in the nuclear industry. Annually, students in the nursing program at NMJC are ranked in the top ten percent of all nursing students in the nation, based on their national testing scores. The NMJC Law Enforcement Academy has been ranked one of the premiere academies in the state. Its instructors are in demand to help police departments throughout New Mexico with updated training for their forces. The NMJC Foundation has awarded over $2.5 million in scholarships and work-study assistance to NMJC students. Another $560,000 has funded program support for students and faculty. The foundation manages over 75 different endowments, annual scholarships and program assistance funds totaling over $8 million. New Mexico Junior College is one of the few community colleges in New Mexico with athletic programs. Student-athletes typically maintain high GPAs while competing. All six of the athletic programs earned post-season berths in either regional or national competitions. NMJC is a full-service institution with student housing, athletics and an aggressive range of traditional, transfer educational offerings. The University Center houses four-year and graduate programs allowing students to move from Day One of their college experience through Bachelors and Masters level programs without leaving campus.

summary: I am a leadership, Management, and Career developer because I know what it feels like not to have a good leader early in my career. I was surrounded by leaders in the wrong positions and people in positions of authority who had no business being there. I want to give people who are considering leadership, those in leadership who are struggling, and executives who are over their heads an opportunity to develop before they hurt someone or themselves. I want to see the day when workers do not have to go home and consume their dinner and talk about the underdeveloped and unprepared leaders they work for. Do you know the leader I am talking about or is that you? Ok, so here is all the other stuff people want to see: I am a Best-selling author of A Lion's Pride: The Scars That Silenced Kings, and I co-authored Voices for Leadership: Your Pathway to Becoming a More Influential Leader, The Latino Leadership Playbook, and Latinos 100. I have served as an Executive, Business Owner, Veteran & Advocate, Board Member, Non-Profit Administrator, Speaker, Mentor, Coach, and Avid Volunteer. Over the past 30 years, I have held numerous executive advisor and senior positions while serving in the United States Navy and civilian sector. Through education and training, I helped strengthen the chain of command and businesses, providing sound decision support and creating open communication at all levels. I also helped formulate and implement policies concerning morale, welfare, job satisfaction, discipline, and training of Navy and civilian personnel. My performance won me the Meritorious Service Medal, Navy and Marine Corps Commendation Medal, Navy and Marine Corps Achievement Medal. I was named 2013, 2014, and 2017 Mentor of the Year, and recipient of the inaugural 2014 Chief John Dungan Jr. Oceanographer of the Navy Award. I was also awarded The Arnold Fletcher Award and inducted into the SALUTE National honors society for my academic achievements. I volunteer actively for various projects and non-profits, earning the esteemed Bronze, Silver, and Gold President‚Äôs Volunteer Service Award. I host the Award-Winning Developing the Leader Within Podcast. On the DTLW Podcast, I share real-world leadership lessons shaped by my personal experiences, challenges, and victories. Having overcome significant obstacles, including 26 years of Naval service, I know what it takes to lead with resilience and authenticity. Tune in for insights on leadership, growth, thriving in adversity, and entrepreneurship, whether you're leading a team or just leading your life.

education school linkedin description (2: Texas A&M University has a proud history that stretches back to 1876 when The Agricultural and Mechanical College of Texas became the first public institution of higher learning in the state of Texas. job description: Work. Together. Across Cultures. The Culture Mastery is a boutique training, coaching, and mentoring firm for global leaders who want to succeed in working across cultures. Our mission is to lead individuals and organizations to a better understanding of their own culture and those cultures they interact with, so they can work at their peak and in peace with each other, through teaching, training and coaching. Our vision is for a more peaceful world and we accomplish this by helping people from different cultures understand each other better. We don‚Äôt deliver training & development widgets; we help you attain a higher level of cultural awareness and competence. By mastering cultural transitions, you will be at peak performance in the global community. At The Culture Mastery, all team members have crossed cultures at least once in their lives. We serve the global business community with these main services: ‚Ä¢ Fractional Chief Culture Officer: Provided by us, your CCO empowers you to build inclusive, adaptive cultures. We embed expertise into your leadership team, guiding strategy, communication, and talent development ‚Äì without the full-time executive cost. ‚Ä¢ Cultural Training & Coaching: In an international context, smart business decisions depend on the ability to bridge cultural differences. Team members need to be able to understand these differences and how to work across cultures. ‚Ä¢ Global Leadership Development: As leaders grow into their international roles, the skills which got them into their position will not be the same skills which will propel their global career. Smart executives learn how to lead in a global context. ‚Ä¢ Expat Services: When international employees take on assignments abroad, the challenges of relocation can make or break the project. Our Destination Services ease the pain of the mundane.

summary: Over the years, I‚Äôve learned that the decisions we make as leaders ripple far beyond the boardroom. They shape careers, cultures, and communities... and, perhaps most importantly, they set an example for the people watching us most closely ‚Äî at work, and at home. I‚Äôve worn many hats: CEO, operating executive, advisor, dealmaker, coach, and podcast host. I‚Äôve led sales from $400 million to over $1 billion in an organic growth cycle, delivered 4x growth in six years, navigated more than a dozen acquisitions, and opened new markets. I‚Äôve worked in public companies, private equity-backed businesses, and family-owned enterprises in the middle of steep growth curves. The scale changes, but the through-line is always the same: connect great people, align them around a shared purpose, and give them the space to do their best work. That belief fuels my work at LEAD3R and as host of The Future of Teamwork Podcast, where I‚Äôve interviewed more than 150 leaders from every corner of the working world. Each conversation is a masterclass in leadership - part learning, part teaching, always a reminder that kindness and clarity are not mutually exclusive in high performance. These dialogues sharpen my own leadership style, helping me find new ways to guide teams that are both values-driven and results-focused. I‚Äôm endlessly fascinated by the changing shape of tomorrow‚Äôs workplace - how technology, community, and business can intersect to tackle big challenges like diversity and inclusion, skills transfer, innovation, and disruption. It‚Äôs a space where curiosity is an asset, and collaboration is both art and science. At this point in my career, I know two things for certain: great teams don‚Äôt happen by accident, and leadership is a privilege that comes with a responsibility to use it well. If you‚Äôre as interested in building purposeful teams and unlocking the potential of people as I am, I‚Äôd be glad to connect.

summary: If you are a CEO, entrepreneur or business owner pursuing mergers or acquisitions as part of your growth strategy, let‚Äôs talk. There‚Äôs a reason CEO's call me an "M&A Whisperer". The title comes from my work advising leaders and organizations on the "unexpected people challenges" of Mergers & Acquisitions. The challenges that can doom a deal but which rarely get covered in M&A preparedness training. I've been on all sides of the deal equation and show leaders what it takes to lead people through change and uncertainty. My leadership lessons came as an international C-Suite executive leading teams through three separate multibillion-dollar deals. I learned firsthand that M&A growth strategies suffer when leaders haven‚Äôt been prepared to guide their teams through the emotional roller-coaster that can occur post-deal. No wonder people struggle to pivot and adapt as quickly as management expects. These insights and lessons were captured in my best-selling M&A business book, "NOW WHAT? A Survivor‚Äôs Guide for Thriving Through Mergers & Acquisitions" which serves as a playbook for executives and handbook for frontline leaders balancing their day job with post-deal integration work. My M&A consultancy, Day1 Ready was founded on the premise that M is for Mindset and A is for Agile. Through one-day workshops and keynotes, I‚Äôve prepared hundreds of CEOs, executives and middle managers to recognize that success in M&A is not solely achieved by following static playbooks; success comes from having an adaptive mindset and an agile approach. Speaking on human capital strategies that drive M&A success, I‚Äôve guest lectured at the University of Chicago/Booth School of Business, Northwestern, and Thunderbird School of Global Management. I write a business leadership column for Forbes and contribute to Harvard Business Review, Fast Company, and Inc. Honored as Entrepreneur of the Year by Northshore Women in Business in 2019, I was recently ranked the #1 M&A Leadership Consultant by Leadership Research Institute and nominated to Thinkers50 2024 Radar list of future management thinkers to watch. Expertise: transition strategist; integration planning and execution; culture assimilation; change management; change communications; M&A on-boarding/off-boarding; brand identity and strategy; B2B marketing and communications Pursuing an M&A deal? Reach out to see how I might support you: Jennifer@jenniferjfondrevay.com
job title: Founder, Day1 Ready LLC ‚ñ∫ M&A Integration Consultant ‚ñ∫ Transition Strategist ‚ñ∫ Change Management
job description: Whether working with entrepreneurs, small/mid-market businesses or Fortune 500 companies, I have seen countless growth strategies fall short because a workforce could not adapt to the changes as quickly as leadership anticipated. In hindsight, it‚Äôs easy to see why people strategies broke down, but by then it‚Äôs too late to intervene. When your workforce is not delivering it can be tough to stop the downward spiral. I guide companies and their employees through unfamiliar waters so that companies never reach that point. As Founder of Day 1 Ready Consultancy, I serve as the transition advisor to senior leadership, ensuring the people component of a company‚Äôs plan, such as leadership alignment, culture assimilation, employee engagement, productivity and retention are an early focus of the deal to ensure success. From senior executives to frontline leaders/ middle managers, I coach them through the transition to be a successful contributor to the company‚Äôs future and to keep the business growth strategies on track. If you want to get your workforce bought in and onboard, retain your top talent, and maintain productivity post-deal, PLEASE reach out: ‚úâ jennifer@jenniferjfondrevaycom ‚òè 312-608-9939 ‚ñ∫ www.jenniferjfondrevay.com

job description (2): From a leadership change to a company restructure to digital transformation, business transitions have key challenges in common -- they bring waves of change and uncertainty upon the workforce. Mergers and acquisitions tend to have the greatest challenges due to the drive to integrate people, processes and systems as quickly as possible to achieve the valuation. In her keynotes and workshops, Jennifer shows how understanding the people piece to M&A integration and change management can be a companies competitive advantage post-deal. summary: I'm not an exit consultant. I help owners build businesses they never want to sell. (Ironically, that's exactly when buyers pay the most.) Most 'succession advisors' are former brokers who've never written a check. I've written millions in checks. ‚úÖ Bought businesses with my own money and advised buyers and sellers in over $250 million worth of small business deals. ‚úÖ Learned how to systematize and grow businesses to not depend on their owners to operate (on my own dime!) ‚úÖ Sold businesses to strategic buyers ‚úÖ Structured management buyouts that actually worked ‚úÖ Helped owners pass to family without destroying relationships ‚úÖ Come from a real-world, dirty fingernails, operational background, not a consultant who only knows spreadsheets. I've sat in every chair at the closing table. That's the difference. ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ THE UNCOMFORTABLE TRUTH: Your business is probably unsellable right now. - You're irreplaceable (buyers run from this) - Your financials tell three different stories - Your team would quit if you left tomorrow - You have no idea what you're actually worth But here's what most owners don't know: The changes that make your business sellable also make it more profitable TODAY. That's why smart owners start succession preparation years before they need it. Not to sell. But to have the OPTION to sell. ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ WHERE ARE YOU? üî¥ TRAPPED: "I can't take a real vacation without chaos" ‚Üí We build systems so the business runs without you üü° GROWING: "I need to scale but organic growth is too slow" ‚Üí We acquire competitors or expand strategically üü¢ PREPARING: "I want options but don't know where to start" ‚Üí We create your succession roadmap (family, management, or sale) ‚ö™ READY: "It's time. Get me the best outcome possible" ‚Üí We run a process that adds 30-50% to your value ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ THE BOTTOM LINE: I don't push anyone toward a sale. That's what brokers do. I help you build a business with options: - Option to run it forever (profitably) - Option to pass to family (smoothly) - Option to sell to management / employees (fairly) - Option to sell to a strategic (lucratively) No options = prison. Multiple options = freedom. üìä Find out where you stand: Send me a message and let's talk about where you are and where you want to be. üìö Or start with my book: "Unlocking Small Business Value" The playbook I wish I'd had for my first acquisition: https://grw.bz/unlock P.S. Still doing everything yourself? It's time to unlock some small business value. Drop me a note and we can talk through how to do that.

linkedin description (2): The goal of Sweetview Partners is to see Texas Small Businesses survive. Maybe you‚Äôre looking to pursue other options, but aren‚Äôt ready to see your business close? That‚Äôs where we come in. summary: The founder makes the difference. Same idea, same market, similar traction‚Äîinvestors bet on the founder who can navigate extreme uncertainty without getting lost in the sauce. This is not trivial. Your job is hard. You're searching for a business model in a particular market that's never been built before, making strategic decisions without clear answers, designing a future company while staying grounded in present reality.Doing this competently requires a specific skillset that most people have never developed. It's about developing the capabilities to search systematically, design strategically, and make grounded decisions when there's no obvious path forward.I have been a founder performance coach for 11 years. I work with pre-seed through Series A founders who are playing the long game, building companies that matter. I help you develop those skills‚Äîusing a venture design framework that gives you structure for the search, context for prioritization, and confidence in your decisions.
job description: KeyChange is a venture design practice that helps purpose-driven startup founders build well-designed companies that create lasting impact. We specialize in working with "Visionary Way" founders‚Äîthose committed to elevating standards and playing the long game rather than seeking quick exits. Through our Venture Design Framework and founder performance coaching, we help early-stage teams gain clarity on their biggest risks, develop competence in startup fundamentals, and build confidence in their unique approach. We provide the tools, strategy, and systematic support founders need to find product-market fit while staying true to their mission. KeyChange exists because we believe the founders who care deeply about what they're building and how they build it should be the ones who win. We're here to make sure they have every advantage possible.
linkedin description: KeyChange is a venture design practice that helps thrive-minded startup founders find customer traction, raise the right capital, and get to Product-Market fit. Founders playing the long game need a different kind of support than today‚Äôs venture industry provides. At KeyChange, we specialize in equipping founders with the language, tools, and strategies to more effectively translate these founders' imagination and ingenuity into the bright and sustainable future they want to build for all of us. We work with founding teams directly and in partnership with mission-aligned programs and investors. Join us.

linkedin description (2): At Seed Round Capital, we believe that running a startup should be fun and profitable. We understand where you are because we've been there too, which is why we formed Seed Round Capital, offering early-stage funding and fundraising support to help you turn your startup into the thriving company you envisioned when you began. Most tech company founders fail on their way to Series A funding because of poor decision-making and lack of direction. They may not even realize some of the mistakes they are making. Seed Round Capital‚Äôs personalized guidance provides expert advising so startups can raise the money they need, enjoy their journeys, and see exponential growth. As an early-stage startup founder you're likely overwhelmed by concerns about running out of money, letting people down and losing your dream. You need cash and customers and can only survive without both of these for so long. Having a great product, some paying customers and working hard have gotten you to this point, but you know you need to take a more formal approach to increase your chances of raising money and being successful. As a startup, it can be very difficult to find the training, funding and support you need to succeed as a business, making you wonder why you even started the business in the first place. At Seed Round Capital we can provide that support you need to become the successful tech company CEO you aspire to be.

summary: I help CEOs and executives move from being ‚Äúoperators who get things done‚Äù to being ‚Äúleaders who create advantage and lasting impact.‚Äù Who are you? Mid-level and senior executives who‚Äôve been told they ‚Äúneed to be more strategic.‚Äù Leaders who are strong operators but struggle to make the shift into strategic roles. Organizations that want their managers at all levels to think and act more strategically, not just execute. New CEOs and executives inheriting entrenched strategies who need to reshape thinking across their teams. 2. What keeps you up at night? Fear of being seen as ‚Äúnot strategic enough‚Äù and getting sidelined or even laid off. Overloaded agendas where everything feels urgent but little feels truly strategic. Frustration with plans that don‚Äôt move the organization forward‚Äîlots of initiatives, little impact. The weight of uncertainty and complexity‚Äînoise, turbulence, and competing priorities. Worry about losing influence, missing opportunities, or being blindsided by disruption. 3. What have you tried? Reading strategy books or attending planning-heavy courses that explain what strategy is but not how to be strategic. Creating long lists of initiatives and cascading them down through the org chart‚Äîonly to produce confusion and traffic jams. Traditional ‚Äústrategic planning‚Äù that focuses on budgets and targets instead of shaping thinking and decisions. Leaning on OKRs or similar tools that masquerade as strategy but don‚Äôt shift behavior or perspective. 4. The transformation you need? To be recognized as true strategic thinkers‚Äînot just operators who execute. To shift from reactive, tactical fire-fighting to enactive, purpose-driven leadership. To see complexity more clearly, prioritize effectively, and focus on leverage points for real impact. To gain influence in their organizations by connecting their work directly to strategy. To build confidence that they can navigate uncertainty and shape the future rather than just respond to it. How I Can Help: ‚ñ∂ CEO Coaching: Personalized coaching for CEOs and Business Unit leaders of 8+ figure businesses, designed to build robust systems for success. ‚ñ∂ Consulting: Strategy and consulting services for Fortune 500-1000 companies, including strategy development, digital transformation, M&A support, and performance improvement initiatives. ‚ñ∂ Online Training Programs: üí° Strategic Thinking For Advantage: A program for aspiring executives to sharpen their strategic skills. üèÜ Win Your Day: An online course sharing my productivity system to help you become more effective.

summary: Focused on ‚ÄúImpact with Integrity‚Äù, Dr. Mah is the Chairwoman & Founder of Stella Foundation, a national conSTELLAtion of organizations and leaders walking alongside womxn-led businesses from startup to sale and the funders who champion them; founding member of Stella Angels, a female angel investment group; Investment Committee member of Next Wave Impact, a social impact venture fund; an angel investor to over 160+ startups who have diverse founders on the leadership team and 15+ emerging fund managers who invest in new paradigms of innovation & impact, and a founding partner of Ad Astra Ventures, that aims to invest in conscious capital resilient founders. Dr. Silvia Mah is also a redemptive entrepreneur and investor serving as the Director of Innovation & Associate Professor at the Crowell School of Business at Biola University and serves as a business & strategy advisor at The Brink SBDC hosted at the University of San Diego. Dr. Mah‚Äôs own success includes producing a globally-recognized podcast, She Invests!, highlighting the investment journeys of female angel investors and venture capitalists & the inaugural Fund Manager for the San Diego Angel Conference Fund I (2019), and co-fund manager for Funds II (2020), III (2021), IV (2022), V (2023), and VI (2024), an angel fund to activate regional & global capital from aspiring and existing angel investors. Dr. Mah has recently served as the President & COO of Connect w/San Diego Venture Group where she supported the merger of two of the most impactful organizations in the San Diego startup scene, Program Director for the Center for Peace & Commerce at the Kroc School of Peace at the University of San Diego where she led the virtual Fowler Global Social Innovation Challenge during Covid, & was engaged for 2+ years as the Student Programs Diversity Director at the Office of Innovation and Commercialization‚Äôs The Basement, a technology accelerator for undergraduate startups at UCSD. Learn more about Dr. Mah at sheinvests.com & enjoy her book, The Startup Investor Mindset, on Amazon. Dr. Mah holds a Ph.D. in Marine Molecular Biology from UC San Diego Scripps Institution of Oceanography, an M.B.A. from UC San Diego Rady School of Management, & a B.S. in Biology with Honors from Pepperdine University. When not working, Dr. Mah enjoys sunny beaches, reading, Disney days, & off-roading with her husband & 3 children + a new daughter-in-law in San Diego. Originally from Caracas, Venezuela, Dr. Mah believes in integrating family and work to create a lifestyle that serves both with a strong cup of integrity.

education school linkedin description (1: Founded in 2003, the Rady School of Management was created as a shared vision by local science and technology leaders with the goal of enhancing the vitality of the strong regional economy. The key to UC San Diego's successful development of innovative undergraduate, graduate, Ph.D., and executive education programs is the unique, collaborative environment cultivated by the region's top technology companies, research institutes and universities in the region. Rady students enjoy vibrant collaborations with other esteemed UC San Diego schools and institutions, including the Jacobs School of Engineering and the Scripps Institute of Oceanography. Joint projects include the Scripps-Rady Ocean Plastic Pollution Challenge, a six-month accelerator program focused on identifying effective ways to curb the flow of plastic into the ocean, with a focus on marine conservation and coastline preservation. summary: Most organizations are built to break under pressure. As complexity grows, roles blur. Trust thins. Decisions stall. Culture becomes a slogan instead of a system. Performance starts to feel like politics. Morale tanks. That‚Äôs not a motivation problem. It‚Äôs a systems failure. And you can‚Äôt fix systems with hype, pulse surveys, or another off-site. You need infrastructure‚Äîthe kind that scales clarity, trust, and execution without burning your team out. That‚Äôs where I come in. I‚Äôm a strategic advisor and fractional Chief People Officer. I partner with CEOs and executive teams to build the people infrastructure that makes leadership sustainable‚Äîand performance inevitable. What that looks like: ‚ñ™Ô∏è Executive onboarding that builds trust & traction‚Äînot just orientation ‚ñ™Ô∏è Leadership team development that shifts behavior‚Äînot alignment theater ‚ñ™Ô∏è Culture operating systems that turn values into decisions‚Äînot wall art ‚ñ™Ô∏è Performance architecture that actually gets used‚Äînot another abandoned framework I‚Äôm typically brought in when: ‚ñ™Ô∏è Culture and leadership aren‚Äôt keeping pace with complexity‚Äîshowing up in turnover, missed goals, or decision paralysis ‚ñ™Ô∏è Feedback and performance systems feel fragile or performative ‚ñ™Ô∏è Legacy habits are blocking next-level execution ‚ñ™Ô∏è A new exec hire or strategic shift needs to land fast and lead hard My edge? I learned to build systems where failure wasn‚Äôt an option. I spent over a decade as a teacher, principal, and system-level education leader‚Äîenvironments where broken systems have immediate consequences. That‚Äôs where I learned to design for equity, lead through complexity, and build trust in high-stakes conditions. Now I bring that same pressure-tested lens to companies that can‚Äôt afford to get people systems wrong. Recent impact: ‚Üí Helped a global nonprofit build shared language and capacity ‚Üí Rebuilt performance management from form-filling to real growth conversations ‚Üí Guided managing directors through M&A transition at a newly PE-backed firm ‚Üí Built strategic roadmap that expanded leadership team impact for a school head Here‚Äôs what I know: You don‚Äôt fix culture with charisma. You don‚Äôt fix performance with perks. You fix them with infrastructure‚Äîclear roles, fair processes, and systems that scale trust. When people systems are designed with intention, change doesn‚Äôt just happen. It sticks. And it spreads. üëâ https://calendly.com/lfriscia/20-minute-discovery-call Want more thinking like this? Subscribe to my newsletter for sharp insights on leadership & culture https://lisas-newsletter-e68d0b.beehiiv.com/
job description: Franca Consulting supports leaders of small and growing organizations ready to go from scrappy to sustainable by building systems, coaching leadership, and aligning your people ops to actually support the growth and sustainability you‚Äôre chasing.
linkedin description: Purpose-led organizations are often built scrappy ‚Äî by necessity, values, and urgency. But as organizations grow or shift, the very things that made them successful can start to strain: decisions slow, roles blur, feedback becomes inconsistent, and execution relies on a few people carrying too much. Franca Consulting helps organizations move from scrappy to sustainable by building leadership and talent infrastructure that increases clarity, capacity, and execution ‚Äî without burning people out. We partner with CEOs, executive teams, and senior leaders in social enterprise, nonprofits, schools, and purpose-led organizations to strengthen the systems that make leadership work: how decisions get made, how roles are defined, how feedback and learning happen, and how change actually lands. Our work is grounded in a simple belief: most leadership challenges aren‚Äôt about effort or commitment ‚Äî they‚Äôre about infrastructure. How We Work We focus on practical, system-level support that leaders can use immediately, including: -Leadership Infrastructure Diagnostics to surface what‚Äôs creating drag and where to focus first -Design & Strategy Sprints to translate priorities into executable plans -Facilitation & Leadership Alignment to build shared language, habits, and decision clarity This is not cookie-cutter solutions or one-off training. It‚Äôs infrastructure-building work designed to support both performance and people. When leadership systems are clear and well-designed, leaders don‚Äôt have to rely on heroics ‚Äî and teams can do their best work sustainably.

summary: WHAT I DO: For more than 35 years and over 600 engagements, I have rapidly helped companies with revenue $5MM to $50MM fix their cash flow and plan cash flow and operations changes for future profitability. Even small businesses can be complex. I help owners and managers understand the cash flow impact of their decisions and actions to ensure optimal operations that lead to good cash flow. In that effort, not only have I been a consultant (now CTP), I have been named a Chapter 11 Trustee, Federal and State Receiver and Assignee. HOW I DO IT: The Newpoint team and I help you create cash flow forecasts and budgets using Cash Flow Launcher‚Ñ¢. We teach owners and managers how to manage cash on their own, but we also deploy our proprietary diagnostic tool (TAME‚Ñ¢) to help with the changes you need to make to ensure your business becomes stronger. Access to TAME‚Ñ¢ trained professionals makes sure you are seeing what you need to make the right decisions for your business. WHY IT WORKS: When you partner with Newpoint, you get the most efficient, effective, and affordable turnaround help. Our ROI is a verified 2700% for owners and stakeholders. WHAT MAKES US DIFFERENT: Our Cash Flow Coach‚Ñ¢ program and our other services are provided on a fixed-fee/fixed-time basis, so you know what it is going to cost beforehand. The tools are designed for rapid deployment, so you can get answers fast (120 Days+)‚Äì because that is what you need. Our proprietary TAME‚Ñ¢ company diagnostic tool with 120 questions and industry best-in-class benchmarking takes the emotions out of the introspection about your business and is designed for rapid deployment ‚Äì again, because that is what you need. These tools have been tested with hundreds of companies like yours. Since founding Newpoint in 2013, CFL‚Ñ¢ and TAME‚Ñ¢ have been able to help financiers recover $1,620,000,000 in debt and saved 14,731 jobs. NEXT STEP: Can we help you? 800-306-1250 kyager@newpointadvisors.us www.newpointadvisors.us
job title: Founder and President - Financial Advisors to Small Distressed Companies and Stakeholder
job description: WHY IT MATTERS: Cash flow is the life-blood of your business. When you struggle with cash flow, it is often due to a lack of understanding about how your business decisions are impacting cash or you have a sense you have tried everything. Frustration leads to doubt and a business suffers as a result. Our clients are the size companies that hire the majority of people and pay most of the taxes in this country. However, these companies do not have consistent access to professional cash flow management that would help them in a time of need. That is where Newpoint comes in. CASE STUDY: Often companies are sent to us when they are in significant trouble. Our job is to move quickly to give them visibility to the issues and come up with viable solutions. We have worked with hundreds of companies that faced game changing decisions, like one mid-west based machine shop. They had been around for years, but since economic turmoil and some personal matters came up, they had not been able to turn a profit. Their lender was fatigued, but not totally ready to give up. We were able to work with management over a two week period of time, put together a Cash Flow Launcher‚Ñ¢ tool that showed where quick changes would solve the immediate issues. The result - their lender stuck with them. TAME‚Ñ¢ helped management see where some longer term changes would make them stronger. The rapid deployment of Newpoint's Proprietary Cash Flow Launcher coupled with professional insight from TAME‚Ñ¢ gave the company the tools to see in days what they had not been able to clear up for several years. STATISTICS: Since founding Newpoint in 2013, CFL‚Ñ¢ and TAME‚Ñ¢ have been able to help financiers recover $1,355,000,000 in debt and saved 13,414 jobs. WHAT I DO: cash flow coaching, turnaround consulting, turnaround management, change company outcomes, restructure debt, refinance distressed companies, sell distressed companies, TAME‚Ñ¢, Cash Flow Launcher‚Ñ¢, free cash flow model.

summary: I‚Äôm the HR partner companies call when they need more than a placeholder‚Äîthey need a builder, an evaluator, and a trusted advisor. I don‚Äôt need an existing playbook. I evaluate, reimagine, and implement systems that align culture with growth and ensure people feel valued, supported, and seen. From BrightView to MVAH Partners, Forta, and Jones Lake Management, I‚Äôve helped organizations shift from reactive to strategic by building HR functions from the ground up. My work spans private equity-backed, founder-led, startup, and scale-up companies‚Äîtypically under 5,000 employees‚Äîacross industries like behavioral health, ABA therapy, affordable housing, manufacturing, and emergency veterinary care. Through my firm, People Solutions Group, I advise CEOs, founders, and investors on how to align people strategy with business goals‚Äîwhether they‚Äôre navigating a merger, restructuring, or preparing to scale. I also serve as faculty with the Human Capital Institute, where I facilitate programs in Strategic HR Business Partnership, Strategic Talent Acquisition, Workforce Planning, Change Management, and People Analytics‚Äîhelping HR and business leaders grow their capability, confidence, and influence. Through my podcast, Amplify Your Signal, I spotlight professionals in transition and elevate the human side of work. Not sure where to start with your people strategy, team evaluation, or how to scale without losing culture? That‚Äôs where I come in. Feel free to reach out‚ÄîI‚Äôm always happy to connect and talk through what you‚Äôre navigating.

summary: I work with smart, ambitious professionals and the organizations they lead ‚Äî helping teams and leaders get unstuck, aligned, and ready to move when things feel complex or high-stakes. I‚Äôve always been drawn to the moments when we're stretched ‚Äî new roles, big decisions, career pivots, team resets. That‚Äôs where we grow - but also where we can be most in need of support. Before founding Resolute Consulting, I had a first career in adult education and a second in professional services leadership. I‚Äôve taught in classrooms, led strategic initiatives inside AEC firms, and advised professionals through key transitions. That dual lens (how people learn and how businesses function) grounds my approach. I combine strategy, learning design, and deeply human facilitation to move clients from good ideas to real outcomes. Today, I partner primarily with organizations to design programs and facilitate engagement that builds confidence and competence, capacity and connection. I also provide leadership advisory and retainer-based support for firms navigating growth, change, or recalibration. Engagements may include: ‚Ä¢ Retreats with teeth ‚Äî and follow-through ‚Ä¢ Strategic planning and leadership offsites ‚Ä¢ Advisory support for firm leaders and teams ‚Ä¢ Leadership development cohorts with real-world relevance ‚Ä¢ Workshop series that respect your time and get results ‚Ä¢ Association and conference programming that blends substance with engagement Clients often say I bring both structure and empathy. I make things clearer, calmer, and more doable, while challenging teams to think and act with purpose. I‚Äôve led hundreds of sessions across industries and know how to meet a group where they are and move them forward. While I offer coaching for a select number of individuals, most of my work happens inside organizations aligning business goals with human needs. If you‚Äôre developing your leadership pipeline, planning a retreat, navigating change, or looking for a strategic facilitator and advisor ‚Äî let‚Äôs talk. üìç Based in DC, available nationwide üîó www.resoluteconsulting.co | joanna@resoluteconsulting.co | 301 873 9481

linkedin description: Resolute helps people and organizations see clearly, think better, and act with intention - bringing clarity, capability, and momentum where growth is required. CORPORATE CLIENTS Growing firms don‚Äôt (usually!) fail because they lack effort. They stall because clarity and capability don‚Äôt keep pace with growth. Resolute helps firms see what actually needs attention, align people and priorities, and develop leaders in ways that change how work gets done. We bring a clear-eyed, both/and perspective - human and business, strategy and execution - to deliver high-quality development that works at the level you need it, whether that‚Äôs one leader or the entire firm. The result is stronger leadership, better decisions, and growth that‚Äôs intentional instead of reactive. INDIVIDUAL CLIENTS Ambitious professionals don't need more advice - they need clarity, perspective, and a place to think honestly. Resolute works with capable leaders who are navigating bigger expectations, more complexity, and higher stakes, helping them separate the signal from the noise and move forward with both confidence and competence. As a trusted thinking partner, we bring structure, insight, and accountability - balancing challenge and support - to help leaders make better decisions, build real capability, and sustain momentum over time. PROFESSIONAL ASSOCIATIONS Professional associations succeed when their leaders are prepared, aligned, and confident - and many volunteer leaders aren‚Äôt given the development they need to lead well. Resolute partners with associations to design and deliver professional development that respects volunteers‚Äô time, intelligence, and real-world constraints while still creating meaningful growth. Our work is practical, human-centered, and rigorous, helping boards, committees, and cohort participants build the competencies and confidence needed to lead effectively and strengthen the organization as a whole.

summary: I‚Äôm an applied anthropologist, executive coach, and reticulist, dedicated to transforming how organizations navigate talent management, leadership, and culture. For over 17 years, I‚Äôve partnered with CEOs, executive teams, and boards across venture capital, private equity, and Fortune 100 companies to align people strategies with business strategies, creating cultures that drive performance and innovation. As a C-suite Advisor on Talent, I specialize in helping leaders thrive amid uncertainty. My approach is rooted in understanding the complex interplay between people and organizations‚Äîdesigning strategies that not only meet immediate business needs but also foster long-term growth and resilience. I‚Äôve had the privilege of consulting for global organizations, including Nike, Amazon, McKinsey, and Microsoft, as well as scaling startups, guiding them through inflection points that required deep leadership transformation and organizational redesign. Leadership, in my view, is not just about the individual; it‚Äôs about the intersection of culture, strategy, and human dynamics. By aligning human capital strategy with business objectives, organizations can navigate complexity and achieve sustainable success. I believe that trust, agility, and strategic talent development are essential for any organization looking to thrive in today‚Äôs rapidly changing landscape. As a reticulist, I bring together diverse, often unlikely, groups of people to create innovative solutions to today‚Äôs most pressing challenges. By convening different perspectives, I believe we can drive breakthroughs that push the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible‚Äîwhether in business transformation, innovation, or addressing societal needs. I also serve as an Advisor for Transform, Sempervirens Venture Capital, and partnership with ON Partners. My board roles include the Advisory Board for The Mentor Project and the Board of Directors for AID International, a nonprofit empowering Haitian communities to achieve self-sustainability. I hold a master‚Äôs degree in Organizational Development from Pepperdine University, where I‚Äôm an Adjunct Professor in the MBA program, teaching Talent Management. I‚Äôm also a member of Marshall Goldsmith‚Äôs 100 Coaches, a premier community of industry thought leaders curated and led by Marshall Goldsmith . Let‚Äôs connect if you‚Äôre looking to move beyond conventional strategies and want to drive human-powered performance in your organization, turning barriers into opportunities.

summary: With my background of owning companies for over 35-years as well as investing in and selling business I have owned I have learned great lessons as a CPA, CFO and CEO. This firm was created to leverage my prior experience to assist business owners as a long-term trusted advisor in the business financial arena. My passion is coaching business leaders to grow revenue, margin, profit, cash flow and ultimately the value of their companies. Whether this is for a 120-year-old multi-generational family legacy company or a startup with a great idea and in need of capital, I serve the gap between the owners, CEO and finance team. I have expertise in growing companies, preparing them for a sale transition and walking them through the process of the sale. I also provide guidance with obtaining capital and optimal debt structure. During my career I have worked with hundreds of business enterprises and provided counsel to buyers and sellers of companies to maximize the value and resulting after tax cash. My passion in working with business owners has been the culmination of preparing the business for sale and successfully transitioning the ownership, with the rewards optimized for the seller. Exit Planning strategy and M&A execution are also areas of my expertise. I bring my experience in board rooms as an active and engaged board member for a select group of companies.

summary: Leadership wasn‚Äôt built for a people-first focus. It‚Äôs time to re-engineer it. I help executives and organizations transform empathy from being seen as a ‚Äúsoft skill‚Äù into a strategic leadership advantage. Using my ROE (Return on Empathy) framework, I turn Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) into Key People Indicators ‚Äì strengthening trust, accelerating decision-making, and improving business outcomes. The truth is, organizations rarely fail for lack of strategy; they struggle because people don‚Äôt feel safe, seen, or supported. Most leaders default to ME-pathy (‚Äúunderstand me, my intent, my stress‚Äù) without realizing it. True EM-pathy (‚Äúlet me understand you first‚Äù) drives psychological safety, retention, engagement, and innovation. My Mission To prove, with data and lived experience, that ROE is the new ROI. My Journey & Expertise I began life with a lesson in belonging -- adopted at three weeks old by parents who taught me worthiness, compassion, and unconditional love. Then came male-saturated industries where those traits weren‚Äôt always valued. I watched brilliant people burn out, values get compromised, and leaders rewarded for bureaucracy over bravery. I led that way once, too ‚Ä¶ until it backfired. My breakdown became my breakthrough. What I Offer EQ Assessment + Debrief A science-backed evaluation of baseline emotional intelligence across four key areas-Self-Awareness, Self-Management, Social Awareness & Relationship Management culminating in a personalized EQ Call to ACTion that becomes each leader‚Äôs roadmap for growth. Culture Consulting (ROE Framework) My signature Return on Empathy (ROE) methodology transforms organizational culture by shifting leaders from ME-pathy to EM-pathy, strengthening psychological safety, trust and communication across all levels within your organization. Keynotes That Create a Bias for Action Dynamic, evidenced-base talks on EQ, empathy, psychological safety and trust‚Äîshowing leaders how to make People FIRST = Performance ALWAYS. Track Record - Creator of the ROE (Return on Empathy) model and International Best Selling Author - Global keynote speaker on empathy, EQ psychological safety (U.S., Africa, Europe, SE Asia) - 25+ years leading teams in engineering, construction & high-risk government projects - Leading organizations from accidental to intentional cultures, rooted in their values and aligned with their vision. - Sparring partner for leaders across STEM, Operations and Federal Government Ready to turn empathy into your next strategic advantage? Book a call üìû with me today!

job description: Imagine building a business where your systems work harder than you do. That‚Äôs what I‚Äôve done ‚Äî and now, I help others do the same. I‚Äôm Tina Servis, founder of Maid 4 Time, a 7-figure cleaning referral company built on a lean, smart model using independent contractors. From scrubbing floors to scaling operations, I‚Äôve lived the journey ‚Äî and cracked the code on sustainable growth. But my story didn‚Äôt stop there. I launched Lead Titan, a marketing and automation agency that helps home service businesses grow 35‚Äì50% year-over-year. How? By blending strategic thinking, systems design, and deep operational insight. As a Fractional COO, I step into businesses like yours to rewire outdated models and spark results you didn‚Äôt think possible. I wonder what would happen if your business ran like a machine ‚Äî not a maze. Other people have already shifted from stress to scaling. What if you‚Äôre next? Whether I‚Äôm examining your margins, trimming costs of goods sold, or mapping automation workflows, my goal is always the same: Help you think differently. Grow smarter. Lead better. I‚Äôm on a mission to elevate service-based businesses ‚Äî and I believe yours could be next. Let‚Äôs make it happen.
job description (2): Founded in Rochester, NY, Tina started Maid 4 Time in 2008 right after the recession hit and her first business Make & Take Gourmet closed due to the economy. Not sure what direction to go in, Tina was faced with going back to corporate or trying her luck at another business venture. While researching small business opportunities, Tina stumbled across a magazine article on the art of house cleaning. Tina began researching the house cleaning business and reached out to her past clients from her first business and started her house cleaning business with one client who was willing to give her a try.

summary: I help organizations create human-centered workplaces where everyone can thrive. I founded Talent and Genius with a simple but powerful insight: hidden talent abounds in every workplace, waiting to be discovered and developed. Throughout my journey, I've observed how building human-centered workplaces allows everyone to contribute their unique perspectives and abilities, creating environments where innovation thrives. My approach combines emotional intelligence, cultural competency, and a deep understanding of human nature to help people become more effective leaders, communicators, and self-advocates. With over 10,000 hours of experience as a consultant, coach, and facilitator, I've developed training and coaching programs that draw out the Deep Genius in professionals, helping them advance their careers, hone their leadership skills, and become powerful communicators. My team and I are on a mission to create workplaces where authenticity is celebrated, voices are amplified, and belonging is the norm. We're particularly skilled at helping organizations bridge communication gaps, build psychological safety, and develop leadership pipelines that embrace a multitude of thinking styles and backgrounds. Our client roster includes leaders in engineering, aerospace, tech, hospitality, government, non-profits, and global consulting ‚Äì from NASA to Microsoft to the University of California. We provide a comprehensive suite of services centered around the DiSC assessment, communication skills through a humanistic lens, coaching for leaders and managers, career advancement strategies for professionals from all backgrounds, and leadership development for emerging talent. Dubbed a "Professional Paradigm Shifter" and a "Geek Whisperer" (from the many STEM professionals I've helped), I've appeared in Forbes, The Huffington Post, Latina, Univision, Bay Area Focus, Smart Money, Redbook, and many popular podcasts. SPECIALTY AREAS ‚Ä¢ Certified Everything DiSC Facilitator and Authorized Partner ‚Ä¢ Communication Skills for Modern Workplaces ‚Ä¢ Coaching Skills for Leaders and Managers ‚Ä¢ Career Growth Strategies for Up and Coming Professionals ‚Ä¢ Leadership Development for High-Potential Talent An avid trivia nerd and unapologetic plant lover, I'm based in the redwood and oak filled hills of Oakland, CA. (Pacific Time Zone) My team and I work virtually and in person, providing support to private 1:1 clients and organizations. Find out more at https://TalentAndGenius.com

summary: As a respected strategic business leader, consultant, executive coach, and mental health advocate, I empower organizations and leaders to transform vision into reality while honoring the human experience at work. With 25+ years of experience across higher education, nonprofits, and corporate leadership, I have guided large-scale cultural transformations, advanced mental well-being initiatives, and built high-performing teams that thrive under complexity. As a consultant and founder of The TrueGuide Leadership Collective‚Ñ¢ and creator of the LifeFirst Harmony‚Ñ¢ executive coaching framework, I help leaders sustain energy, clarity, and authentic impact in a rapidly evolving world. I believe vulnerability is a strength - not a weakness - and frequently deliver keynote talks and workshops that champion authentic, transparent storytelling on the very topics others fear to address. My approach demonstrates what it means to walk the talk, creating trust and psychological safety from the top down. My commitment extends beyond the boardroom. I have served as a publicly elected trustee for a public school board of education, overseeing policy, data-driven governance, and community partnerships to support more than 16,000 students. As a change agent, I have led cross-sector task forces and strategic committees, aligning diverse stakeholders to drive forward impactful, mission-aligned initiatives. Throughout my career, I have: ‚úÖ Led multimillion-dollar divisions and major organizational restructures, improving performance, talent pipelines, and fiscal sustainability ‚úÖ Developed people-centered strategies that strengthened trust, psychological safety, and team performance ‚úÖ Built public-private partnerships advancing mental well-being, resilience, and high-impact leadership ‚úÖ Delivered keynotes and executive coaching to help leaders align values, culture, and decision-making ‚úÖ Served as a trusted advisor to boards, executives, and communities, guiding governance, crisis response, and strategic change Above all, I believe leadership is an act of service - and the most effective leaders align their inner clarity with external action. I welcome opportunities to connect, collaborate, and keep growing this mission with others. I am excited to expand my professional network & look forward to hearing from you. If you would like to connect, please contact me at drjoeoravecz@gmail.com.

linkedin description: Tompkins Cortland Community College is one of 30 community colleges and 64 campuses in the State University of New York system. Located in Dryden, the college serves more than three thousand students in credit programs and another three thousand in non-credit workshops and customized training. The college offers more than 45 academic programs in business, computers, health, communications, liberal arts, criminal justice, and human services. Specific degree programs include broadcast production, computer forensics, engineering science, new media, sport management, hotel and restaurant management, wine marketing, and several liberal arts programs, including education and general studies. The college attracts a diverse student body from most counties in New York State, several other U.S. states, and nearly 70 countries. The learning environment is enriched by students of all ages and backgrounds. About half of the college's graduates transfer as juniors to bachelor's degree programs at a wide variety of colleges and universities around the world, including Cornell University and Ithaca College. TC3 students study both full-time and part-time, and the college is a leader in online education. The college operates extension centers in Ithaca and Cortland. TC3 is extensively involved in our community. The college provides contract training for most major employers and provides an array of non-credit workshops designed to build skills relating to computers, leadership and supervision, personal growth, and many other areas. As a learning-centered college, TC3 is strongly committed to building on strengths to achieve student success.
linkedin specialities: Tompkins Cortland Community College, higher education, community college

summary: I am a Certified Management Consultant (CMC) with a can-do approach to business. I am passionate about designing, delivering, and implementing innovative and practical business strategies by combining my in-depth knowledge, experience, and expertise in a variety of functional areas of business. I am passionate about business strategy, and have a keen understanding of working with for profit, non-profit, and co-operative organizations of all sizes in a variety of industries, including retail, tourism, hospitality, manufacturing, and professional services. I also have extensive experience in working with First Nations communities as a consultant on economic development and empowerment initiatives in a variety of geographical regions and with a variety of business models, including co-operatives. I am also a Certified Customer Experience Professional (CCXP), a Certified Sales Professional (CSP), and a Certified Exit Planning Advisor (CEPA), and bring an innovative and creative approach to developing customer and employee experience, sales and service strategies, and engaging others to establish recommendations for business development and other business activities that add and sustain value. My consulting practices are complemented by the ISO 20700:2017 guidelines for the effective delivery of management consultancy services. My experience and expertise in customer experience helps organizations solve their challenges by seeing things from their customers' perspective. I have worked with clients in a variety of industries to develop strategy, enhance brand awareness, generate leads, support sales teams, and grow their business. My strengths are building trust by listening to and connecting with people to quickly address their needs, and collaborating with them to visualize solutions that are focused on defining, achieving, and enhancing their strategic objectives. My career has been well balanced among management consulting, strategic planning, marketing strategy, project management, B2B and B2C sales, business development and entrepreneurial management, with a particular emphasis on building, nurturing, and sustaining client relationships. Living by the mantra of well done is better than well said, I emphasize the successful implementation and execution of initiatives that make a positive and sustainable difference by being on target, on time, and on budget. My experience is complemented with exceptional business acumen, entrepreneurial spirit, and proven success in communicating, executing and monitoring strategic business initiatives.

summary: I invite evolution. First for myself. For over 15 years, I have been supporting leadership and organizational development towards systems change, providing coaching, consultation, and facilitation around inner development, organizational alignment, strategic learning and evaluation, and policy/advocacy strategy development. I have worked internationally and domestically, with front-line staff to executives from nonprofits, philanthropy, healthcare organizations, collective impact initiatives, and educational institutions. I serve at the intersection of the multitude of our humanity and the complexity of our systems. I am grounded in the premise that systems change often happens through the personal transformation of its members. I am passionate about supporting greater insight, awareness, clarity, purpose, alignment, and courage for individuals and organizations. Attuned to personality patterns that make us uniquely human and cultural patterns that make us humankind, I am curious about eliciting the implicit value orientations that guide our attention, thinking and behavior. I am committed to examining systemic conditions while exploring new mindsets, power dynamics, and relationships to bring about a new reality. One of my great joys is to ask questions and hold space for discovery.

We seek to create conditions and engage in processes that deepen our awareness, strengthen our interconnectivity, heighten our clarity, intrigue our purpose, explore our alignment, and spur us to step forward with courage.
