summary: With 30 years experience in Georgia‚Äôs state child welfare system, I spent my career helping one organization improve how it serves children and families. I began in frontline child welfare work and moved into county, regional, and statewide leadership roles‚Äîeventually serving as Deputy Director, Director of Field Operations, and Chief of Staff for the Georgia Division of Family and Children Services. Across those roles, I led major reforms, built strong teams, and helped leaders navigate high-risk environments. After retiring from state service in 2018, I shifted into consulting and coaching. I am also the head coach and owner of Drive Multisport, where I coach triathletes, runners, and ultra-distance athletes. As a 10-time Ironman finisher and Boston Marathon qualifier, I draw on years of endurance training and athlete development in my coaching work. Today my primary focus is writing and faith-focused work. I‚Äôm the author of The Long Way Home: A Catholic Return to Faith, published by Wipf and Stock in 2025, which shares my return to the Church and offers encouragement for others hoping to reconnect with their faith. I‚Äôm drawn to roles and projects that combine leadership, mission, clarity, and service‚Äîespecially those that help people or organizations grow stronger in purpose. Always open to connecting around writing, Catholic leadership, endurance coaching, or strategic consulting.
job title: Author ‚Äì The Long Way Home: A Catholic Return to Faith
job description: Independent author; this book is published by Resource Publications, an imprint of Wipf and Stock Publishers. This is an author partnership, not an employee role. linkedin description: WHO WE ARE AND OUR VISION Based in the land of great microbrews and towering Douglas firs, Wipf and Stock Publishers is a creative team, an adventurous bunch who arrive to work with mud still on our shoes from the weekend ride or hike. Our staff handles every step of publication in-house, from customer service to editing and typesetting, from printing and binding to shipping. Committed to writing that honors the imagination, intellect, and heart, we have a simple yet provocative model: with a list as diverse as our Northwest landscape, we publish based on the merits of content rather than marketability. Without agenda, we are shamelessly unapologetic about what we like: relationships, good beer, fine books, and enough coffee to keep us moving. We believe in voice and breadth. From biblical studies to classic theology, poetry to history, our authors are experts, scholars, and artists. By combining innovative technology with academic excellence we are able to produce affordable books of enduring value. Our books never go out of print, and building lasting partnerships is always our focus.

job description: RARE Coaching & Consulting is comprised of over 30 certified coaches who support senior and emerging leaders to increase self-awareness, emotional intelligence, and overall impact and effectiveness. RARE also supports clients through critical moments of transition. Coaching Services RARE is sought after to support the uncommon leader who is operating in spaces where they may find themselves as The Only; The Only among an underrepresented group, The Only who desires to challenge tradition and homogeneity (even while holding a dominant identity). If your life experience, your identity, or your cognitive processes are underrepresented in your elite organization, RARE can provide the coaching support you yearn for. We create spaces where code switching and covering are no longer the elephants in the room. This approach provides a unique opportunity for clients to be whole and transparent, while discovering and owning their values, leadership voice, and personal goals. The result is increased clarity, empowerment, and scaled impact and success. The emphasis on self-sustainability, resilience and self-direction is highly valued by our clientele. Clients include executives from: Starbucks, Gap, Inc., Adobe, Uber, DocuSign, S&P Global, Varian, Sephora, confidential listing of athletes and celebrities, and a range of non-profit organizations. Consulting Services RARE provides consulting support for: - Creating and sustaining a workplace where talent can thrive; - Development of dashboards for measuring diversity and inclusivity of organizations and teams; and, - Development of strategic and sustainable diversity, equity and inclusion initiatives that result in measurable outcomes and collaborative input and buy-in, and long-term sustainability. Sample of clients: Intuit, Wieden + Kennedy, Wasserman Music, Google, Pokemon, Bristol Myers Squibb, Boys and Girls Club, Pugh Capital Investments, City of Seattle, Satterberg Foundation, PATH, NanoString Technologies
linkedin description: Discover RARE Coaching & Consulting as your destination for transformative leadership development. Founded and led by Aiko Bethea, we're not just a consultancy; we're a movement towards empowering the exceptional leader within. Our focus? Elevating senior and emerging leaders by boosting self-awareness, emotional intelligence, and effectiveness, especially for those who navigate under-represented identities in elite spaces. RARE is where the unique challenges of code-switching, covering, and imposter syndrome are not just recognized but actively dismantled. Our bespoke coaching unlocks a sanctuary for authenticity and transparency, guiding you to fully own your values, find your true leadership voice, and achieve your personal goals. Embrace the RARE advantage and step into a world where your unique journey is not only understood but celebrated. With us, clarity, empowerment, and impactful success aren't just outcomes; they're guarantees. Join RARE Coaching & Consulting Group and unlock the extraordinary leader within. Let's make a lasting impact together.

summary: Iain is a dedicated father of four, seasoned entrepreneur and venture capitalist. summary: As a business owner, you‚Äôre often pulled in too many directions, leaving crucial operational challenges on the back burner. That‚Äôs where I come in. As a Fractional COO, I step in to solve the pressing problems you don‚Äôt have the time to address‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs improving efficiency, reducing turnover, or preparing for major growth. My goal is to take the operational load off your shoulders so you can focus on what matters most: driving your business forward. WHAT IS A FRACTIONAL COO? A Fractional COO is an experienced Chief Operating Officer who works with your business on a part-time or project basis. You get the expertise of a full-time COO without the overhead costs. I step in to manage your operations, streamline your processes, and tackle the day-to-day challenges that you simply don‚Äôt have time for. From optimizing systems to improving profitability, I ensure your business runs smoothly so you can focus on growth. HOW I HELP YOU! Operational Problem-Solving: I specialize in taking care of the crucial issues that often get overlooked, from inefficiencies in your business to implementing systems that save time and money. Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A): If you're looking to grow through acquisitions or prepare your business for sale, I provide comprehensive guidance on sourcing deals, managing transactions, and integrating operations. Strategic Growth: Whether scaling a franchise from one to multiple locations or growing market share for real estate brokerages, I create tailored strategies to fuel sustainable growth. WHAT SETS ME APART: I understand that running a business is stressful, and I approach my clients with an empathetic, non-judgmental attitude. My role is not to point out what‚Äôs wrong but to work alongside you to find solutions and make your business stronger. I know the pressure you face, and I‚Äôm here to help. My background in real estate and franchising means I bring industry-specific expertise, but my unique, people-first approach ensures we build a relationship based on trust and understanding. LET'S CONNECT: If you‚Äôre ready to take your business to the next level or simply want to explore how I can help you grow, let‚Äôs chat. Feel free to message me here on LinkedIn or email me at guybarretta@thecooguy.com SPECIALTIES: Strategic Planning‚óò Project Execution ‚óò P&L Analysis ‚óò Mergers & Acquisitions ‚óò Business Development ‚óò Market Analysis ‚óò Sales Management ‚óò Business Consulting ‚óò Strategic Thinking ‚óò Team Leadership ‚óò Coaching & Mentoring ‚óò Process Optimization ‚óò Operational Strategy ‚óò Revenue Growth
job description: As the President and CEO of Barretta Consulting, I bring over 25 years of invaluable experience in the small business and real estate industries. My journey in this dynamic field has been multifaceted, encompassing roles as an Agent, Regional Vice President, Strategy Director, Chief Operating Officer and Consultant. Beyond the professional realm, my journey reflects a deep commitment to understanding the challenges entrepreneurs face daily. This commitment led me to found Barretta Consulting, driven by a mission to "guide your strategy one success at a time." As a Fractional COO, I specialize in helping business owners manage day-to-day operations effectively without breaking the bank, allowing them to concentrate on the core aspects of their business. * Fractional COO and Business Consultant to residential and commercial real estate brokerages as well as to small to medium size businesses throughout the United States. *Assist brokerages and companies with growth, strategy, operational efficiency and recruiting. * Work with companies and brokerages to help them with the operational decisions they cannot get to including new technologies to implement, streamlining of internal processes and putting together training and development programs for employees, agents and associates.

summary: I am a practical strategist, leadership coach, author, and professor working at the intersection of faith and real-world impact. Drawing from experience as a business executive, pastor, educator, and a leading voice in the U.S. faith and work movement, I am passionate to see people fully activated and engaged in their callings, to accelerate and facilitate transformation of leaders and organizations, and for the local church to be equipped to lead people into a biblical understanding of faith, work, and economic wisdom. I was an Area Vice-President with AT&T by age 30, then served as a pastor under Pastor Rick Warren at Saddleback Church where I was the architect and visionary of Saddleback@Work, the workplace ministry. Currently, I am an ICF certified leadership and strategy coach, a professor of ethics, leadership, and strategy at The Crowell School of Business at Biola University, and the Director of the Talbot Center for Faith, Work & Economics where I empower believers to work from biblical principles in all areas of their lives and work with pastors to build organizational competency in the local church to effectively disciple people in their work life. I hold master's degrees in both leadership and theology from Biola University and have studied in the Executive Program at Columbia University. Specialties include: ‚Ä¢ Executive coaching ‚Ä¢ Leadership development ‚Ä¢ Strategic and operational alignment ‚Ä¢ Ethics ‚Ä¢ Organizational change and cultural transformation ‚Ä¢ Employee engagement ‚Ä¢ Theology of work ‚Ä¢ Walking out the calling in the marketplace ‚Ä¢ Women‚Äôs leadership and influence ‚Ä¢ Faith-work integration in the local church ‚Ä¢ Research on sustainable worklife ministry models for impact ‚Ä¢ Developing and maintaining workplace small groups

linkedin description: Welcome to the Crowell School of Business where we provide a distinctive approach to business leadership. We call it Business as Ministry. Why is this important? Because business touches every area of contemporary life from the latest products to essential services, and we can‚Äôt live without the benefits today‚Äôs companies provide. But we regularly read about corporations or even whole industries that seem to stumble from one ethics-related crisis to another. We see failures of leadership at once-trusted brands that cast doubt on pursuing business as a career. Can business be conducted in a way that benefits society, builds profitable and sustainable companies, and is consistent with Christian faith? At the Crowell School of Business our faculty believes that business may be one of the most impactful career choices available for lives of service today. Whether in a public or private company, for profit or non-profit, known brand or entrepreneurial start up, the knowledge and skills you gain at the Crowell School will be valuable for a lifetime of impact. Why are we uniquely positioned to provide this distinctive approach to business leadership? Because the Crowell School faculty along with the other five schools at Biola University take the integration of faith and knowledge seriously as it applies to business, theology, the arts and sciences, humanities and more. Few business schools work so intentionally to pull from various academic and spiritual disciplines to equip students for lives of significance and impact. At Crowell, business education is designed so you learn and put into practice career-relevant business skills while engaging your faith and launching your career. We invite you to learn more about our School and programs by following us on LinkedIn and going to our web page. Or even better: come by and visit us some time!

summary: As the Founder & CEO of Espindola Management Group (EMG), I lead a visionary team dedicated to advancing organizational transformation, workforce development, business leadership, and holistic human development. With over four decades of cross-sector experience‚Äîincluding private, public, and nonprofit‚ÄîI‚Äôm driven by a deep belief in authentic leadership, emotional intelligence, and the power of transformation. Through EMG‚Äôs three core capstones‚ÄîConsulting, The Aligned Executive Coach‚Ñ¢, and The House of Grace Wellness‚Ñ¢‚Äîwe deliver innovative solutions rooted in purpose, resilience, and community wellbeing. Our work empowers leaders, uplifts communities, and bridges the personal with the professional for meaningful, sustainable impact. Wesley College and its athletic facilities are located on 50 acres in historic Dover, Delaware. Dover is the capital of the nation's first state and has 35,000 residents. The campus is situated in Dover's major residential community with stores and banks in easy walking distance and malls a short commute. In addition to being the site of many pre-Revolutionary War buildings and sites, Dover is also the home of Dover Air Force Base and Dover Downs International Speedway, which hosts two annual NASCAR races. The city has a number of fine eating establishments as well as a wide variety of fast food restaurants. Seafood is a specialty because of the city's proximity to the Delaware and Chesapeake bays and to the Atlantic Ocean. New York City, Baltimore, Philadelphia, and Washington, D.C., are within a two to three hour drive of the campus. Most of the College's 2,500 students come from the Middle Atlantic region. The majority of full time students enroll directly from high school, but the College does provide programs for nontraditional students. Wesley attracts students interested in a personal approach to learning, with a 13:1 student to faculty ratio.

summary: Anne Tammel, founder of Global CEO Collective and SoCal Women in Business, is a chief executive advisor and strategy consultant, guiding organizational leaders through cultural transformation, competitive positioning, and strategic growth. Redefining leadership, author of Poets and Dreamers: Thought Leaders and Visionaries and the forthcoming OC CEO Journal, Anne is a public speaker who leads transformative, high-engagement business experiences and CEO masterminds focused on leadership strategy, executive presence, and entrepreneurial mindset. Drawing on decades of experience across Silicon Valley, global corporations, and entrepreneurship, Anne brings clarity, structure, and human-centered strategy to organizations navigating growth and transition. Her advisory background includes executives from Google, YouTube, Microsoft, Citi, Bank of America, Merrill Lynch, EY, PwC, Deloitte, Neiman Marcus, Macy‚Äôs, IBM, Baxter, gold-medal Olympian athletes, global nonprofits, founders, and emerging ventures. Having begun her career at the Silicon Valley's leading PR firm, Cunningham Communication, architecting positioning strategy and brand communications frameworks for the most influential leaders in tech, Anne‚Äôs philosophy blends Silicon Valley strategy with the USC Marshall ethos of organizational excellence, emotional intelligence, and contemporary leadership design. Drawing from her work as founder of Poets and Dreamers LLC, where Anne developed a positive team culture model for high conflict organizations, Anne now curates and leads high-engagement executive leadership events, CEO roundtables, executive masterminds, leadership retreats, and programs that strengthen cultural identity, elevate executive presence, and unlock collaborative performance. With a Master of Executive Leadership from USC, an MFA in Creative Writing, and as an MBA candidate from USC Marshall, Anne is an ICF Professional Certified Coach (PCC), an ICF Advanced Certified Team Coach (ACTC), who integrates systems thinking, emotional intelligence, and neuroscience. Recognized by CBS Los Angeles for leading community transformation, Anne leads a regional movement focused on redefining leadership, uniting and elevating women in business, and shaping organizational identity. - Strategic Planning, Growth + CEO Advisory - Leadership Development Programs + Summits - Communications, Positioning + Thought Leadership - Culture Transformation + Organizational Identity - Executive Leadership Strategy - Team Coaching; Collective Performance - Emotional Intelligence; Resilience Development

job description (2): Our Mission Engage all segments of our community to drive sustainable change in education, income, health and homelessness, while continuing to address urgent and basic human care. Our Vision Metro Atlanta is a place where all individuals and families thrive.
linkedin description (2): When children thrive, we all thrive. Kids are born with limitless potential. And every child ‚Äîfrom McDonough to Marietta, from College Park to Norcross, from Atlanta to Austell‚Äîdeserves the opportunity to thrive. But in Greater Atlanta, thousands of kids are faced with roadblocks where they should be met with possibilities. When we unite, we can unlock their potential, creating a brighter future, for every community. Our Child Well-Being Index shows that in 79 neighborhoods across our region, child well-being is declining. These neighborhoods are located in every one of Greater Atlanta's 13 counties, and often they're separated by just a few short blocks from the neighborhoods with the most access to opportunity. For the 77,000 youth who call these neighborhoods home, that means that they're facing inequitable barriers to success. They have big dreams‚Äîbut gaps in opportunities and resources stand in their way of achieving them. These aren‚Äôt just numbers. They‚Äôre our neighbors. When you join the movement to improve child well-being, you open pathways to opportunity, helping to: - Give more families access to quality early learning programs, so kids become strong learners. - Provide apprenticeship opportunities for youth, equipping them for high-growth careers. - Put college within reach for more families, through academic supports and financial aid access. - Set individuals up for financial stability, through stable housing, access to healthcare and employment opportunities. - Support community-led solutions, so that everyone‚Äîregardless of race or zip code‚Äîcan thrive. Our guiding question is ‚Äúhow are the children?‚Äù United, we‚Äôre working toward a future where we can respond with ‚Äúall the children are well.‚Äù Join the movement at unitedwayatlanta.org

summary: You know how hard it is to buy fresh food at reasonable prices year-round that hasn‚Äôt travelled thousands of miles and arrived at the grocery store still ‚Äúgreen‚Äù? Nearly 19 million people in the US live in ‚Äúfood deserts‚Äù, meaning they don‚Äôt live near a grocery store. It‚Äôs not just lower-income folks that struggle. Big cities like LA and NY and Chicago have trouble providing fresh food to its citizens. I work with architects, engineers, farmers, and city planners to create buildings that come alive and are a source of food for the people that live there. There tends to be a struggle between architects, engineers, and city planners to develop indoor farms that meet strict building codes, are architecturally attractive, and can grow the foods that people want to eat. Growing thousands of plants indoors with these building restrictions quickly complicate the project. The people that are involved in these projects have specialized knowledge, like a musician in a symphony. They are experts at their instrument and look to the Conductor to provide guidance on when and how to play so that the music is played beautifully for the audience. I‚Äôm like the conductor when it comes to these big projects. I can ‚Äúsee‚Äù how, when, and where, the players need to bring their specialized knowledge to create the building that grows the food desired by the audience (in this case, the people that live in the city). Conductors know when certain instrument need to play louder, softer, and not at all. As the conductor, I know when to engage the engineers, architects, farmers, city planners and funders. When people work with me, they know they are an integral part of the team and how their role fits into production. More important, they can focus on bringing their specialized skills and talents to the project, free from the stresses of micromanaging components that don‚Äôt excite them or detract from what they love working on. What kind of food sustainability projects are you trying to build? I'd love to listen and see how I can support your efforts.

summary: ‚Ä¢ What is the meaning of life? ‚Ä¢ You are living life as if what is its meaning? ‚Ä¢ Do you know why you are here and for what purpose? ‚Ä¢ How do you measure your life? ‚Ä¢ Are you satisfied with the quality of your life? It all started with a paradox. Years ago, I went through a difficult period asking myself precisely the questions above. Searching for answers, I discovered that others shared my concerns. As I described it in my first book, I faced a paradox: "Humanity does not suffer from a lack of answers; rather, it suffers despite the answers being available." This paradox became the central quest that led to the start of a new school of psychology: meaningful purpose. Fortunately, I discovered the answers to these existential questions, solved the paradox, and built a practice to help people get the necessary remedies. The point? You, too, can deal with your own paradoxes and benefit by finding the answers to these existential questions. So, if you have big plans and have been giving your all ‚Ä¶ YET you are struggling with any of the following ‚Ä¶ ‚Ä¢ Resistance to your efforts to make a positive difference at work and in social settings. ‚Ä¢ Lack of Support preventing you from achieving your professional goals and life dreams. ‚Ä¢ Discouragement from trying to bring to life relationships that should thrive but don't. ‚Ä¢ Frustration that your contributions are not being acknowledged and appreciated. ‚Ä¢ Disappointment with people who are indifferent and unresponsive to your contributions, aspirations, and talent. ‚Ä¢ Exhaustion from investing in long hours at work for little to no appreciation. ‚Ä¢ Disappointed that your life lacks meaning and direction. But there is hope! The Boston Institute for Meaningful Purpose has something to end the pain. It is called "Meaning Analysis and Improvement." When you harness the "Meaning Analysis and Improvement" method, you will ‚Ä¶ ‚Ä¢ Deepen your self-understanding and of your surroundings. ‚Ä¢ Build your self-confidence. ‚Ä¢ Discover your strengths and confront your weaknesses courageously for self-improvement. ‚Ä¢ Discern what other's agendas and their motives are. ‚Ä¢ Know the "real" root cause of a problem or situation. ‚Ä¢ Understand what your options are and how to select the most promising one. Check my LinkedIn references to read what some of our happy clients say. I will be happy to meet you through Luis@bostonimp.com and www.bostonimp.com. Boston Institute for Meaningful Purpose. Discovering Life‚Äôs Answers.

linkedin description: The International Positive Psychology Association (IPPA) is a global membership organization of thousands of academics and educators, practitioners and clinicians, students, and others ‚Äì from over 70 countries worldwide. The field of positive psychology focuses on the study and practice of positive emotions and the strengths and virtues that make all individuals, institutions, and communities thrive. The field has seen hundreds of millions of dollars invested into research, the founding of scientific journals, creation of baccalaureate degrees and masters and Ph.D. programs at universities, TEDx Talks, and reports and cover stories in major news and media outlets worldwide (including Forbes, The Atlantic, The Washington Post, The Guardian, Time Magazine, Parents Magazine, Wall Street Journal, Newsweek, U.S. News & World Report, and more). In addition, award-winning books and publications on both the science and practice of positive psychology have been released through publishing houses including McGraw-Hill, Wiley, Simon & Schuster, Penguin, and others ‚Äì increasing global exposure and prominence. IPPA's three-part mission is: - To promote the science of positive psychology and its research-based applications. - To facilitate collaboration among researchers, teachers, students, and practitioners of positive psychology around the world and across academic disciplines. - To share the findings of positive psychology with the broadest possible audience. In all of these endeavors, IPPA works to create rigorous standards for positive psychology, so that the field always represents the very best levels of current knowledge. If you share in this mission and vision, we hope you will consider joining us.
job description (2): Since 1986 we have been enabling people and institutions to succeed in their meaningful purpose. company (2): The Boston Institute for Meaningful Purpose
linkedin description (2): Meaningful Purpose coaching and teaching center; helping people realize their potential to grow and thrive through meaningful purpose. Marrero in 1986 in Boston, Massachusetts with a mission of helping people realize their potential to grow and thrive through meaningful purpose by creating informative and engaging ways to learn, integrate, and practice MP.

linkedin description (4): Businesses often struggle to get to the next level. Staff do their best to execute on the organizational mission and vision, but do so in silos, with their processes disconnected from one another, stuck in one person's head. As a result, customer experience can be hit-or-miss, balls get dropped between departmental handoffs, spreadsheets shuffle, and companies stall in growth. As organizations grow, the processes and practices that served them until now won't serve them in the future. Adding new layers of leadership and management requires upgrades to the way companies communicate and collaborate. With over 20 years experience helping organizations rapidly grow from 50 to 500+ employees, implement digital transformation initiatives, and build and document repeatable processes, Strategic Matter can help you identify the most important next steps in your strategy. Our process begins with a comprehensive assessment of your organization, incorporating your leadership team's perspectives on the current identity of the organization, deep analysis of the entire company's capacity for change, and a collaborative inventory of your operational maturity in over 47 facets of your business operations. From there, we customize an action plan prioritized to match your objectives and move your company forward with accountability and clarity. To gain momentum, we'll walk with you through implementation and ongoing management and improvement, revising the roadmap for your business as the horizon changes. Our extensive network of specialists can help fill any gaps - from HR, to marketing, to accounting and finance, to technology, we can help you build your team and go to your next level.

job description: When you are a Fortune 500 business unit leader, small business owner, or senior leader of a mid-sized organization, you deal with your share of leadership challenges. My clients know how much I care about building personal relationships and delivering the proper strategic insight at the right time. summary: I‚Äôm Keith Liscio, the Founder and President of Excelsior Franchise Center. My background and experience have uniquely prepared me to serve as a consultant and coach to prospective business owners considering an investment in a franchise system. My mission is to work with clients to winnow thousands of franchises down to a handful of good options, and ultimately the perfect business for them. I grew up in a series of small, family-run businesses ‚Äì everything from a dry-cleaning shop to a liquor store to a meat market/deli/bakery. After getting a degree in marketing from Villanova University (and later an MBA from the Wharton School) I turned my attention to the corporate world working at Fortune 500 Companies like Procter & Gamble, Nabisco, and Kraft. Eventually, I became an entrepreneur importing ceramics from Italy and then spending almost 20 years running my own Executive Recruiting firm. I was even employed by a couple of franchisees along the way, flipping burgers at McDonald‚Äôs in college and working at one of the Midwest‚Äôs leading offices for Management Recruiters International. If I‚Äôve learned anything along this journey it‚Äôs that running a business is NOT for everybody. Entrepreneurship is even tougher, taking long hours, expertise, commitment, and a high tolerance for risk. That said, business ownership can be incredibly fulfilling and offers many benefits in terms of work/life balance, financial rewards, and tax advantages. Best of all, being your own boss can be great. Really great. For many people, buying a franchise business can be the best way to become a business owner. You‚Äôre investing in an established system that‚Äôs already successful. You‚Äôre in business for yourself, but not by yourself. There are hundreds of options available allowing buyers to choose a business that capitalizes on their strengths and interests while accommodating their preferred working styles. Best of all, I know the GOOD franchises, can save you time and money, and there is no charge for my service. All my fees are paid from the marketing budgets of my franchise partners. If you‚Äôre serious about being in business, I can find one that will fit your needs. If you‚Äôd like to learn more, schedule some time on my calendar and I‚Äôd be happy to answer any questions you might have. Just click here: https://meetings.hubspot.com/keith-liscio

summary: As a Ranger-qualified and battle-tested US Army officer, I have developed the skill to operate under pressure and lead when ambiguity and chaos replace well-planned strategy and tactics. After a 30+ year career in high-tech, comprised of both start-ups and enterprises, I founded the 20/20 Consulting Group to help leaders operate their organizations. Every organization runs on an invisible operating system => the flow of collaboration, influence, communication, knowledge, and trust that determines how fast work moves and how effectively strategy turns into results. By revealing this hidden system, leaders can see their Employee Relationship Capital: the collective value of employees, and their networks, who accelerate execution, broker trust across silos, and enable influence to flow through relationships that are invisible to org charts. Org design and work can be highly tuned and strategically adapted to fluid, ever-changing conditions. Scenario planning and critical employee decisions are supported by the following: => Which employees are the connectors and bridge builders? => Where does collaboration, communication and influence break down? => Which overly connected employees are at risk of burnout? => Who are the must retain employees? => Who are the sources of innovation and knowledge sharing? => Where do investments in people deliver the highest returns? By measuring how work and information flow, leaders are empowered to make informed decisions on the human side of performance and unlock faster execution and higher economic throughput from the organization they already have. Based in Broomfield, Colorado, I‚Äôm a father, coach, and advocate for veteran leadership in business.
job description: I help executives identify the people their organizations rely on most‚Äîbefore making the decisions that matter most. By revealing the invisible operating system of collaboration, knowledge, and trust, I surface the Employee Relationship Capital that drives execution, innovation, and adaptability. This clarity reduces risk, accelerates strategy, protects critical talent, and strengthens organizational resilience‚Äîespecially during transformation, restructuring, or rapid growth. I‚Äôve lived the cost of flying blind; now I help leaders operate with clarity, confidence, and precision.

summary: An Executive Strategy Consultant, focused on solving big problems for organizations and individuals, utilizing education approaches and coaching to lead through transitions and achieve desired maturity and transformation. Driving organizational development and leadership, executive assessment and improvement, and defining and activating strategy--with special interest in delivering high value customer results and achieving organizational health. A versatile and proven partner, flexibility and creativity in defining and driving approaches within your culture to ensure your success is my specialty. Keeping the big picture in mind while accomplishing high value tactical delivery by interfacing effectively with all levels of the organization as well as with external concerns. Experienced in operations and technology solutions design and implementation preparing for new business development needs, mergers, conversions, regulatory drivers and organizational expansion or dissolution. Well-versed and practiced in business architecture, process and technical methodologies, traditional portfolio management and structured analysis approaches, vendor contracts and relationship management, large, risky program delivery and problem solving techniques--all brought to bear for the benefit of the mission. Linda brings her experience as a leader, architect, advisor, community-builder, consultant, practitioner, speaker and coach for the benefit of your organization. Having recently completed her 5 year tenure as Chief Architect for Cargill and continuing since 2010 to lead the TCBAF Business Architecture Community, Linda's commitment to equipping organizations and individuals for success persists. Her sincere and straight-forward style ensures her effectiveness as a trusted adviser who has enabled improvement, facilitated formation of vision and strategy, and guided desired transformation across a diverse set of organizations. Linda focuses on clarifying individual and organizational purpose as a critical starting point in maximizing the skills and talents individuals bring to organizations, and designing business capabilities for extraordinary results; she is an enthusiastic proponent of the practice and performance of enterprise and business architecture to drive strategy, transformation, and growth.

job description: The Forum is an association of local Business Architecture professionals dedicated to understanding, documenting and implementing improvements for Business Architecture. The Twin Cities Business Architecture Forum (TCBAF) is a Minnesota-based organization dedicated to the understanding and advancement of the role and professional practice of business architecture. It exists to promote common definitions and standards, share ideas, and connect like-minded professionals with networking through meetings, activities, presentations, and educational development opportunities at the local level. Founding sponsors of the TCBAF include Express Scripts, Metropolitan State University, Target Corporation, Thrivent Financial, Trissential and other prominent Minneapolis organizations. Bi-monthly two hour meetings are held at a sponsor‚Äôs location. Meetings feature a brief presentation followed by a facilitated roundtable discussion ‚Äì a free flow of ideas is encouraged! There are no dues or membership fees associated with TCBAF at this time.

summary: Most teams I work with don‚Äôt have a pipeline problem. They have a decision and conversion problem. Deals stall once they enter the organization. Champions lose momentum. Approvals slow. Revenue looks committed but never actually lands. Founders bring me in when that gap becomes visible and the business needs real revenue movement in the next 30 to 90 days, not another planning cycle. I operate as a Revenue Operating Partner. I work inside live deals, coaching founders and reps where decisions are breaking down, not periodically reviewing dashboards after the fact. Part founder advisor. Part deal strategist. Part GTM architect. How I help: ‚Ä¢ Diagnose where deals are truly failing: decision ownership, internal alignment, risk tolerance, or economic justification ‚Ä¢ Coach founders through commercial sequencing, trade-offs, and hard calls that teams avoid making‚Ä¢ Work directly inside active deals to equip champions with forwardable, CFO-ready business cases that survive executive scrutiny ‚Ä¢ Establish a simple operating rhythm that improves deal quality, speed, and predictability without adding process overhead Typical outcomes: ‚Ä¢ Six- and seven-figure opportunities reactivated after stalling‚Ä¢ Material reductions in deal cycle time once decision friction is addressed ‚Ä¢ Clear internal narratives that unlock approvals without escalation‚Ä¢ Founders regaining control of revenue conversations with boards and investors ‚Ä¢ Improved revenue execution preceding successful acquisitions I‚Äôm not a generic founder coach, and I‚Äôm not a fractional CRO. job description (2): Who We Are: I founded the You Are a GIFT Foundation to help mothers overcome prescription drug addiction and restore wholeness in their lives. After experiencing the personal loss of my daughter, I gained a profound perspective on what truly matters in life. This realization inspired a mission to provide mothers with the education, support, and resources they need to overcome addiction and rebuild their relationships and purpose. The foundation‚Äôs name, ‚ÄúGIFT,‚Äù reflects our core mission: to help individuals Reflect God‚Äôs Image and Fulfill their Talent in service to others. By empowering mothers to heal and thrive, we aim to glorify God through purposeful living. How We Help: At the You Are a GIFT Foundation, we focus on partnering with local organizations and nonprofits to address the unique challenges mothers face on the journey to becoming addiction-free. Through strategic collaborations, we provide: - Access to education and rehabilitation programs. - Tailored solutions to overcome obstacles preventing recovery. - Awareness campaigns to promote addiction prevention and family restoration. Our work is centered on offering a pathway for mothers to rebuild their lives, strengthen their families, and reclaim their purpose. Why We Exist: Prescription drug addiction often leaves mothers struggling to navigate the path to recovery alone. Our foundation exists to fill this gap by partnering with organizations to provide critical support, foster awareness, and pilot funding initiatives. Our ultimate goal is to empower mothers to overcome addiction, rebuild relationships with their families, and live meaningful, purpose-driven lives.
linkedin description (2): Thousands of mothers in America are affected by prescription drug addiction. Our mission is to provide them with the education and assistance they need to restore wholeness. Our Mission: The You Are A GIFT Foundation is a regional non-profit based in Alabama that partners with organizations to help mothers overcome prescription drug addiction so they can live a meaningful life. Our Vision: To help mothers overcome prescription drug addiction. What We Do: At You Are A GIFT we collaborate with organizations that are equipped to identify the obstacles that prevent mothers from receiving rehabilitation. We exist to promote addiction prevention, drive awareness, and pilot funding; all with the goal of restoring relationships for mothers and their families.
linkedin specialities (2): Drug addiction, Addiction, Addiction prevention, Mothers and Families

linkedin description (4): The mission of the United States Air Force is to fly, fight and win ‚Ä¶ in air, space and cyberspace. To achieve that mission, the Air Force has a vision of Global Vigilance, Reach and Power. That vision orbits around three core competencies: developing Airmen, technology to war fighting and integrating operations. These core competencies make our six distinctive capabilities possible. Air and Space Superiority: With it, joint forces can dominate enemy operations in all dimensions: land, sea, air and space. Global Attack: Because of technological advances, the Air Force can attack anywhere, anytime and do so quickly and with greater precision than ever before. Rapid Global Mobility: Being able to respond quickly and decisively anywhere we're needed is key to maintaining rapid global mobility. Precision Engagement: The essence lies in the ability to apply selective force against specific targets because the nature and variety of future contingencies demand both precise and reliable use of military power with minimal risk and collateral damage. Information Superiority: The ability of joint force commanders to keep pace with information and incorporate it into a campaign plan is crucial. Agile Combat Support: Deployment and sustainment are keys to successful operations and cannot be separated. Agile combat support applies to all forces, from those permanently based to contingency buildups to expeditionary

job description (4): The U.S. FREEDIVING FEDERATION is sanctioned under CMAS.org, the worldwide underwater federation, and sits under the International Olympic Committee. The mission of the U.S. Freediving Federation is to bring awareness to freediving across the United States and support the efforts of all those that engage in the sport, whether it be for self-exploration and adventure, therapeutic benefits, or purely competition ‚Äì in the safest manner possible. ‚Ä¢ Founded the organization in 2018 and scaled to over 500 members nationwide ‚Ä¢ Sanctions depth and pool freediving competitions across key regions including Dominica, Florida, California, Virginia, and Hawaii ‚Ä¢ Established USFF as a registered 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization ‚Ä¢ Designed and led national fundraising initiatives to support U.S. National Team participation at World Championships ‚Ä¢ Developed and published safety standards and educational content to promote responsible and safe freediving practices ‚Ä¢ Built and continue to expand a nationwide network of certified technical delegates and judges to enable sustainable competition growth
linkedin description (4): THE U.S. FREEDIVING FEDERATION IS PART OF THE WORLDWIDE UNDERWATER FEDERATION, THE CMAS ORGANIZATION. Started in 1959 by Jacques-Yves Cousteau, and recognized by the International Olympic Committee and UNESCO, CMAS comprises over 130 federations including the United States as one of the charter members. CMAS is a prestigious organization dedicated to the development of all underwater activities and sport disciplines on a worldwide basis. The U.S. Freediving Federation is the youngest member of the CMAS family and happy to help continue the legacy started by Mr. Cousteau. The mission of the U.S. Freediving Federation is to bring awareness to freediving across the United States and support the efforts of all those that engage in the sport, whether it be for self-exploration and adventure, therapeutic benefits, or purely competition ‚Äì in the safest manner possible.

job description: Founded and lead a national organization that creates and maintains an ecosystem that helps schools and districts recruit, retain, and retire Black male teachers, by cultivating the skills of Black males as early as kindergarten, and coordinating institutional pathways for them to matriculate to and through the profession.
linkedin description: Black male teachers have shown to have the greatest impact on student achievement. But, they make up only 1.3% of the profession. To shift this, we need an earlier start and longer support. We see today‚Äôs Black male students as tomorrow‚Äôs Black male teachers. Our goal is for young Black males to discover teaching, then support them at every point on their path to and through the profession. We do this through direct programming and key partnerships. This is The Black Male Teacher Initiative. PreK- High School: In our I AM KING Program (IAK), we train and mentor Black male high school students to deliver social-emotional learning content to younger boys of color. College: Black male college students join our Fellowship in the summer, where they receive instructional support to teach middle school students. Fellows engage in Black male affinity groups during their experience. In the following school year, they have access to additional professional development and networking opportunities, including taking our Introduction to Education, Equity, and Identity course, taught online and accredited by the University of Massachusetts Lowell. He is Me pays for the course! Career: The Black Male Teacher Network is a virtual space for Black male teachers to connect, build community, and engage in identity-based professional development opportunities. Teachers are trained to facilitate affinity groups for their peers, college students, and high school students in our programs. Field-Building: The Building Black Male Teacher Pathways Summit convenes leaders in the education sector to reflect on their initiatives to inspire and support Black male teachers through collaboration. Our lifelong focus provides a clear pathway for Black males to become and remain teachers. As a result of our programs and partnerships, schools will recruit, retain, and retire more Black male teachers.
linkedin specialities: Teaching and Learning, Black Identity, Male Identity, Education, Mentorship, Leadership, social-emotional learning, SEL, training, development, teacher pipelines

summary: With 20+ years leading enterprise transformation, I specialize in driving sustainable, technology-enabled change for organizations in financial services, technology, and manufacturing. As founder of Agility Educators, I partner with executive leaders to help modernize complex infrastructures‚Äîembedding continuous improvement and sustainability principles into both business units and organizational culture to ensure lasting, human-centered transformation. summary: The PSC (People Strategy Consulting) Team I lead provides "Workplace and People Solutions". I also serve as a Leadership/Career Coach for other consulting firms. We serve companies of all sizes, in service, manufacturing, educationand non-profit organizations to optimize their greatest asset ---their People! Partnering with our clients, we do this by selecting the best talent with cutting edge selection tools and processes, and then coach, train and develop this talent to provide their top performance that maximizes business results in a very positive, constructive work culture. Our PSC Team's expertise can help your company by: Coaching & Developing Leaders & Key Associates: Individual coaching for emerging, developing and strategic leaders, as well as, key individual contributors, in one of two ways: (1) One-on-one with a designated professional coach for a 3-9 month period, where a leadership development plan is created and implemented, or (2) by "Just-in-Time" Coaching allowing a leader to obtain a one time or multiple coaching session and support from a professional coach on a "as needed and confidential basis" for a specific issue or situation. Developing High Performance Teams and Engaging Employees: A customized Team Coaching process over a series of Team sessions is developed based upon issues and concerns the team has, as well as to address any Team dysfunctions, which all teams must overcome! Focus is on team relationships, team tasks and goals, individual accountability and a plan of action is developed and implemented. Keeping People in the Know: A plan is developed to engage the hearts and minds of your people through internal communications that inspires trust and secures commitment. Tools and ideas to help leaders in their role of enhancing communications is a major focus, as well as alternative ways to provide messages and engage all employees. Developing the Blueprint for the Future: At the organizational level, the PSC Team can help your company survive turbulent times and strategically plan for the next phase of your company‚Äôs growth. This is done by facilitating strategic planning sessions to align your company's vision, mission, people and processes, to achieve organizational goals. We also help companies create a "positive company culture" or enhance their current culture, implement change initiatives, and develop succession management processes to assure on-going leadership for the future.

linkedin description (3): The Leader Transition Institute prepares and walks beside people who are making pivots in their lives. Concurrently, we help small and large organizations maximize their abilities to communicate and lead, as well as improve their hiring process. We are a veteran-led 501(c)(3) organization supporting Federal and State Government customers in both CONUS and OCONUS locations. We provide training and coaching to help people - anyone, anywhere - who want to bridge the gap between where they are and where they want to be. For service members, veterans, and military spouses, Changing Focus: Moving From We to Me - 24 hours of hands on, interactive training over four days - fills the gap left by the Department of Defense mandated Transition Assistance Program that focuses only on future employment and post-service benefits. Our corporate training division provides leadership, communications, and diversity and inclusion training to both small and large organizations. In nearly three years, we've helped 150 people in 23 states, four countries and three continents learn about who they are as a person - aside from their rank or position and what they've already done in their life, they've become better communicators, and created a vision for themselves of the purposeful life they want for their future. We've also helped them improve their resumes so they've gotten job interviews, and increased their salaries by tens of thousands of dollars. We're proud that our participants tell us that in addition to everything else they learn from us, one of the important things they learn is that they're not alone. They tell us they're grateful to become part of a tribe that gets them. We're a young organization, but focused and excited for the future.

summary: Most capable leaders don‚Äôt struggle because they lack skill. They struggle because the leadership game they‚Äôre winning no longer scales. At a certain point, what made you successful still works but it starts creating friction. - Execution slows. - Decisions pile up. - Effort increases, but impact doesn‚Äôt compound the way it used to. That moment is an inflection point. - Nothing is broken. - Performance is strong. - But the rules of the game have changed. Most leaders respond by working harder inside the old game. That usually makes things worse. üìçI work with capable leaders and executive teams at these inflection points when growth requires a different leadership game. My work focuses on helping leaders recognize: üî∏ when they‚Äôve outgrown the game they‚Äôre playing üî∏ where their leadership model no longer fits the level of complexity üî∏ and how to update how they think, decide, and operate together so execution regains clarity, speed, and resilience This is not a performance problem. It‚Äôs not a motivation issue. It‚Äôs a leadership operating system mismatch. Where I Focus I work upstream of burnout, reorgs, and stalled execution, helping leaders shift from: ‚Ä¢ Expert leadership ‚Üí system-level leadership Designing decision architecture instead of personally solving problems ‚Ä¢ Alignment by effort ‚Üí alignment by design Reducing coordination friction and decision latency across teams and stakeholders ‚Ä¢ Heroic contribution ‚Üí scalable impact Ensuring leadership effort converts into strategic outcomes, not exhaustion Background 20+ years of experience across Asia, Europe, and the Americas, working in complex, global environments where leadership scale and system design matter. Former global talent and organizational development leader in Fortune 500 contexts, with deep experience advising senior leaders navigating growth, complexity, and reinvention. That same discernment and discipline now underpin my work with leaders at inflection points. How We Work at Potentia My work begins with diagnosis and focuses on system-level change, not heroic effort. ‚Ä¢ Leadership Operating System Diagnostic Brief (entry point) ‚Ä¢ Leadership OS Intelligence Mapping (by invitation) ‚Ä¢ Reinvention OS Lab (system-level execution upgrade) You don‚Äôt need to simplify your environment. You need a leadership system built for it. üìß nsage@potentia.cc üåê potentialeadership.com

linkedin description (2): Mission: The COMMIT Foundation empowers those who have served and their families to create purposeful and fulfilling transitions by providing personalized programs, resources, and the support of community. The COMMIT Foundation is where your next chapter begins! The COMMIT Foundation catalyzes the potential of high-performing individuals who have served their nation with distinction and sets the conditions for future success. COMMIT is where the most promising leaders are nurtured‚Äîthose who are ready to lead and determined to make a meaningful impact across business, academia, nonprofits, and beyond. summary: You didn‚Äôt start your business to run every department. You had a vision. You saw a better way to serve customers, lead people, and grow something meaningful. But somewhere along the way, you became the bottleneck. You‚Äôre stuck in the weeds. Solving problems you didn‚Äôt cause. Approving decisions you shouldn‚Äôt have to make. Every new hire or process adds complexity, not clarity. That‚Äôs where I come in. I help Visionaries like you build real businesses, not high-paying jobs. As a Fractional Integrator and COO, I step in as your Second-in-Command. I bring structure to the chaos, create clarity around roles, and build systems that keep your team moving forward without constant input from you. I‚Äôve spent 25+ years doing this across industries: tech, telecom, construction, service, distribution, and several others. I‚Äôve led teams as an VP of Operations, Integrator, President, and COO. Today, I work with companies between $2M and $50M who are scaling fast and feeling the pressure. Most are running on EOS¬Æ and have an Implementer‚Ñ¢ or graduated from one. Here‚Äôs how we work together: 1. Clarify the structure ‚Äì Clarify your Accountability Chart so everyone knows who owns what. 2. Install discipline ‚Äì Use tools like scorecards, Rocks, and Meeting Rhythms that actually get traction. 3. Free you to lead ‚Äì Remove you from day-to-day ops so you can stay in your zone of genius. When the right operational structure is in place, everything changes. You get your time back. Your team gets aligned. And your business becomes something you can grow, scale, or even sell. Let‚Äôs turn your company into the business you originally set out to build. Based in Fairhope, AL - Available Nationwide

summary: Fourteen years ago, I relearned how to walk. That experience is the foundation of my work today. It taught me what it truly takes to perform under max pressure. Now, I partner with organizations to help their people and teams in high-stakes, dynamic environments become totally unshakeable. My journey started during my recovery when I discovered a passion for the human side of performance. This led me to a stint in journalism, covering the inner workings of Major League Baseball player development for NPR. Being on the ground gave me a deep understanding of the complexity, ambiguity and risk that leaders and staff in pro sports and entertainment face every day. Then I launched my own practice, How We Won. Now I serve as the long-term strategic partner to talent at organizations in the most demanding industries, helping them build the personal and team resiliency to create winning leadership and cultures. I've delivered over 4,500 sessions to employees at top companies like Google, American Express and Warner Bros. Discovery. I‚Äôm an ICF Professional Certified Coach (PCC), Master Certified Coach (MCC) candidate, and QE Executive Certified Coach (ECC). I also have a B.S. in Psychology. I believe an individual's personal strength and health are the most important drivers of an organization‚Äôs success. ‚ÄúKim is more than a coach. She's a strategic partner. She has a unique ability to help you peel back the layers of complex, multi-faceted challenges until you find the core issue. I went into our work feeling overwhelmed and left with a profound sense of clarity and peace. She doesn't just help you solve problems. She helps you see that you were never broken to begin with.‚Äù - VP, Global Partnerships at a Fortune 100 Company My services are optimized for organizational needs and include: Trainings, Workshops and Coaching (Executive, Team, Leadership, Onboarding, Career Path, Shadowing).

summary: I believe leadership is learned in practice. It‚Äôs built through awareness, connection, and the confidence to show up with intention, even when the path isn‚Äôt clear. This shapes how I‚Äôve led and built leadership and talent development for 2 decades. In my career, I‚Äôve designed and led leadership development, performance management, and career path initiatives across organizations at different stages of growth. I partner closely with executives, HR leaders, and managers to strengthen the everyday moments that define leadership: setting direction, giving feedback, navigating ambiguity, and supporting people through change. Through FutureForm, I work with leaders and teams to develop three timeless leadership capabilities: Clarity - Helping leaders focus on what matters most and communicate it so teams can move forward with confidence. Connection - Building trust, psychological safety, and real understanding between leaders and their teams. Confidence - Supporting leaders to lead with steadiness and authenticity, without relying on control. Career clarity is a core part of this work. When leaders and employees understand their strengths, values, and direction, performance improves, engagement deepens, and retention follows. Clarity at the individual level strengthens leadership at the organizational level. Alongside my work with FutureForm, I‚Äôm open to leadership or advisory roles where I can build, evolve, or scale leadership and performance systems rooted in human-centered, practical leadership. If you believe leadership is the lever for what comes next, let‚Äôs talk.
linkedin description: Leaders today are navigating relentless change but without the time or support to grow in place. At FutureForm, we help leaders and organizations grow at the pace of change - without losing what makes them human. We create space for growth in the moments that matter most: stepping into new roles, leading new teams, or navigating complex transitions. Our work build the systems and mindsets that fuel confident, connected, and future-ready leadership. Because when people grow, leadership strengthens, and organizations transform.

education school linkedin description (1: The George Washington University, an independent academic institution chartered by the Congress of the United States in 1821, dedicates itself to furthering human well-being. The University values a dynamic, student-focused community stimulated by cultural and intellectual diversity and built upon a foundation of integrity, creativity, and openness to the exploration of new ideas. The George Washington University, centered in the national and international crossroads of Washington, D.C., commits itself to excellence in the creation, dissemination, and application of knowledge. To promote the process of lifelong learning from both global and integrative perspectives, the University provides a stimulating intellectual environment for its diverse students and faculty. By fostering excellence in teaching, the University offers outstanding learning experiences for full-time and part-time students in undergraduate, graduate, and professional programs in Washington, D.C., the nation, and abroad. As a center for intellectual inquiry and research, the University emphasizes the linkage between basic and applied scholarship, insisting that the practical be grounded in knowledge and theory. The University acts as a catalyst for creativity in the arts, the sciences, and professions by encouraging interaction among its students, faculty, staff, alumni, and the communities it serves. The George Washington University draws upon the rich array of resources from the National Capital Area to enhance its educational endeavors. In return, the University, through its students, faculty, staff, and alumni, contributes talent and knowledge to improve the quality of life in metropolitan Washington, D.C.

summary: By the age of 22, I'd: - Founded 4 businesses and sold 1 - Founded 2 non-profits and been program director at a 3rd - Directly mentored 300+ young entrepreneurs - Been appointed to faculty of an Ivy League University - Published 2 books Most importantly though, I do what I love and I love what I do. linkedin description (2): Located in historic Providence, Rhode Island and founded in 1764, Brown University is the seventh-oldest college in the United States. With its talented and motivated student body and accomplished faculty, Brown is a leading research university that maintains a particular commitment to exceptional undergraduate instruction. Brown‚Äôs vibrant, diverse community consists of about 6,200 undergraduates, 2,000 graduate students, 490 medical school students, more than 5,000 summer, visiting, and online students, and over 700 faculty members. Brown students come from all 50 states and more than 115 countries. Undergraduates pursue bachelor‚Äôs degrees in more than 70 concentrations, ranging from Egyptology to cognitive neuroscience. Anything‚Äôs possible at Brown‚Äîthe university‚Äôs commitment to undergraduate freedom means students must take responsibility as architects of their courses of study. Brown University has 51 doctoral programs and 28 master‚Äôs programs. The broad scope of options vary from interdisciplinary opportunities in molecular pharmacology and physiology to a master‚Äôs program in acting and directing through the Brown/Trinity Repertory Consortium. Around the world, nearly 90,000 Brown alumni are - in the words of Brown‚Äôs charter - leading lives of ‚Äúusefulness and reputation‚Äù in every imaginable field of endeavor. Through events around the globe, reunions on campus, career resources, a host of online connections, and other services, the Brown Alumni Association fosters and supports a vibrant alumni community, wherever its members may be.

summary: If you're reading this, you're curious. Curious people are intelligent people. I thrive on curiousity. My summary used to be the same-old rote descriptions of all the things I thought I was. It included words like "strategic", "collaborator", "leadership-driven", "people-centric", and so on‚Ä¶ I AM all those things but what about the PERSON behind the ROLE? Where did she go, I wonder? Well, a COMPLETE burnout in HR during the pandemic and two, yes two, subsequent layoffs in two years, I'm finally free of the constraints our modern workplace norms have become. I would now describe myself as a former Human Resource professional who woke up one day and had enough of the games, the politicking, working the grind for someone else only to be a cog in the wheel. It became untenable. I was reminded that we really can only control the "controllables"... ... how we respond to change, the integrity with which we handle ourselves, how we manage our home & finances, how we take care of and love those who we love, and ultimately where/when/how we steward the gifts and time we've been given. Jobs will come and go but who you are in the in-between matters most. I recently read a famous quote that made my stomach turn and my pulse race ..."The majority of people die at 35 but aren't buried until 75" - I see what this represents all around me and have my whole career. People on autopilot, no self-reflecting, not thriving, not clear on their God-given purpose and direction. I believe God wants better for you and for me. You have a LOVELY calling ... ready to discover what that is? Follow my journey: The Making of Something Lovely @ www.lovelycalling.com

education school linkedin description (1: The University of Portland was founded in September 1901 by Portland Archbishop Alexander Christie, who had purchased property atop Waud‚Äôs Bluff with financial assistance from the Congregation of Holy Cross in South Bend, Indiana. Archbishop Christie named the school ‚ÄúColumbia University‚Äù after the mighty river that flowed nearby, and when it opened its doors, it was staffed with priests from the archdiocese. Columbia University achieved junior college status in 1922, and in 1925 the College of Arts and Sciences was founded. Four years later the first bachelor‚Äôs degrees were awarded to a class of seven men. In the 1930s, the University‚Äôs name was changed to the University of Portland, the St. Vincent Hospital School of Nursing became part of the University as the College of Nursing, and the School of Business were created. In 1948, the School of Engineering was created. The University established its Graduate School in 1950 and the School of Education in 1962. In 1967 the Congregation of Holy Cross and the University‚Äôs Board of Regents transitioned to a shared governance structure. Today, the University continues to be guided by the Congregation of Holy Cross and governed by an independent board of directors. The University of Portland is the only school in Oregon to offer a College of Arts & Sciences, a graduate school, and nationally accredited programs in the schools of business, education, engineering, and nursing. In 2013, University of Portland was named one of America's "Green Colleges"‚Äã for the fourth consecutive year by The Princeton Review. In 2013, U.S. News and World Report named the University of Portland one of the top ten Western regional universities. The University has been named a top ten regional university for 19 years running. In 2012, the University of Portland ranked first nationwide among master‚Äôs institutions with the number of students who won Fulbright awards for the third consecutive year, according to The Chronicl...

summary: I‚Äôm an Organizational & People Strategy consultant who partners with founders, leaders, and teams to build the systems, behaviors, and cultures that support sustainable, human-centered growth. After more than two decades in People & Culture and HR leadership roles ‚Äî from start-ups to public companies ‚Äî I shifted my work to focus on what I‚Äôm most passionate about: helping organizations strengthen their foundations, develop purposeful leaders and teams, and navigate growth with clarity and intention. I support clients through strategic consulting, leadership and team development, facilitation, coaching, advisory work, and, when needed, fractional support. My work often centers around: ‚Ä¢ Organizational, business & culture strategy ‚Ä¢ Leadership, team & culture development ‚Ä¢ People systems and foundational HR infrastructure ‚Ä¢ Performance & feedback frameworks ‚Ä¢ Coaching, facilitation & talent development ‚Ä¢ Employee experience & engagement My approach blends strategy with humanity and is shaped by several practical and research-backed frameworks. I use the Five Facets of Business‚Ñ¢ to help leaders look holistically at their organization, and I integrate principles from Appreciative Inquiry and Intentional Change Theory into my leadership and team development work as I continue expanding my practice in these areas. I complement this with behavioral tools such as Tilt365, DISC, Motivators, and The Six Working Geniuses to support self-awareness, communication, and effective collaboration across teams. I frequently work with early-stage and growth-minded organizations, particularly in tech and professional services, while remaining open to meaningful work in new environments. ü§ù I partner best with leaders who value clarity, collaboration, and intentional growth. ‚ú® Certified in Tilt365, DISC, Motivators & multiple leadership development tools üéì Pursuing a Master‚Äôs in Leadership & Organizational Change (CWRU) üé§ Available for speaking, workshops, coaching, consulting, advisory, and fractional engagements üì© Let‚Äôs connect if you‚Äôre navigating growth, culture, or leadership transitions.

job description: At Partnered Up, I specialize in building and evolving people strategies that foster alignment, elevate employee experiences, and support leaders through sustainable growth. summary: A recognized B2B growth expert and coach, I help B2B leaders accelerate & de-risk growth through strategic market innovation. CONTACT ME for a complimentary consultation at 216.333.4569 or Kelly@LawrenceInnovation.com. I'm the one people call to deliver new business growth. With over 20 years of experience spanning Fortune 500 companies, privately held businesses, and startups, I'm grateful to have partnered with global leaders and coached hundreds of team members to drive top and bottom-line growth while unlocking new business opportunities: strategy to execution. I strive for continuous learning, so it's an honor to serve as a contributing author to WhatTheyThink, an AIM Institute coach and Innoquest community member. I've enjoyed the learning that has come from authoring globally recognized market reports and working with global teams over the years. I am thrilled to share insights with others who share the vision of improving organic growth processes and results. When you choose to work with me, you gain a partner who cares about growing your business just as much as you do. Specializing in strategic market innovation, my boutique advisory firm helps B2B leaders de-risk and accelerate organic growth for long-term sustainable business results. My approach is recognized for delivering value-driven partnerships and measurable ROI. I am humbled that my clients who collectively represent over $120 billion in annual revenue, partner with me to solve real-world problems that make a significant impact. ORGANIC GROWTH EXPERTISE From initial market assessment through demand creation, I help you analyze your unique situation and develop practical action plans to accelerate organic growth. I also help teams build stronger competency in front-end-of innovation processes for higher hit rates. Before founding Lawrence Innovation, I delivered impactful innovation results at Fortune Brands' Moen and Berkshire Hathaway's Lubrizol. My teams typically have a hit rate upwards of 60% versus industry averages of under 5%. What would it do for you if you could improve your hit rate by 10x? MY VISION Walt Disney said, "If you dream it, you can do it." I say, of course you can, but make sure it matters to your customers before you build it. MAKING IT MATTER Passionate about making the world a better place, I live and play in Greater Cleveland, Ohio with my husband and two daughters - my why. I relish learning new things. Hobbies include traveling, standup paddle boarding, hiking with my pal Zeke (English Black Labrador), baking, & reading.
job description: Lawrence Innovation, LLC helps B2B leaders accelerate & de-risk growth through strategic market innovation. Our tailored services are designed to deliver sustainable growth from strategy to execution with a proven framework. We and our partners provide end-to-end-strategic-marketing support from fuzzy front-end-of-innovation opportunity analysis to value delivery through: Consulting: Opportunity analysis, value proposition clarity, and go-to-market strategy to seize new growth opportunities. Training: Build internal excellence with our training programs in Strategic Marketing, Innovation, and Value Selling. Coaching & Facilitation: Executive coaching, strategic planning, and de-risking facilitation to sharpen decision-making and execution. Fractional Support: On-demand strategic marketing and new business development expertise when you need it most. Our clients learn how to stay in touch with customers through deep dialogue, develop the right offers, develop and communicate unique value propositions and nail a profitable business model with proven revenue streams. When you work with us, you get high caliber strategic marketing and business development as a variable cost. We operate as an independent consultancy with strategic alliances for zero overhead. This means you get real business growth expertise and the tools of a large firm at significantly lower costs with greater flexibility versus hiring full-time employees. We bring direct experience across B2B industries including: digital printing, textiles, packaging, chemicals, building products and C-level education in financial services. Contact us when you are ready to scale or need to pivot.

summary: As a strategic advisor, coach, and consultant, I help business owners, founders, and managing partners simplify complexity, create clarity, and drive sustainable growth. WHY MY EXPERIENCE MATTERS TO YOUR BUSINESS: I spent my career leading marketing, sales, and business development for well-known consumer brands and manufacturing firms. While my expertise began in consumer-driven industries, the principles of growth, positioning, and strategy apply universally and are just as critical for professional service firms as they are for consumer brands. Professional service firms struggle with differentiation, client acquisition, and scaling. Consumer brands focus on creating emotional connections, brand loyalty, and effective go-to-market strategies. My expertise blends both, helping professional service firms apply consumer-driven insights to win more business while guiding consumer brands to develop lasting market impact. summary: I'm Kat, a Finnish-American ICF-certified executive and leadership team coach, facilitator, and speaker with 25+ years of experience in global organizational and leadership development. I help leaders and organizations create a culture of inclusion and psychological safety where innovation thrives. My master‚Äôs degree in Mental Health Counseling informs my holistic, research-backed coaching framework. Together, we explore new perspectives and identify solutions for growth and success as well as health and well-being. In 1998, I moved from my native Finland to New York City. I was the first in my family to earn a college degree and, like many others, I craved the energy, inspiration, and diversity of life in NYC. I held career services and HR & development roles before founding my independent coaching practice. My expertise lies in international and highly-demanding professional contexts‚Äîsince founding my practice, my work has taken me to Helsinki, Rome, Bangkok, and Bonn and I‚Äôve worked with leaders based across six continents. Sisu‚Äîthe Finnish concept of resilience‚Äîand my own personal experiences as an immigrant have deeply influenced my coaching philosophy. My approach to coaching is built upon a core belief in our human capacity to learn and grow, to succeed through challenges, and live and lead with purpose. Alongside my coaching practice, I am an experienced senior non-profit founder and board leader. I have founded, led, and developed several global and local non-profit community organizations over the past 30 years. After I moved to NYC, I founded two non-profit organizations with and for Nordic women. I have served as vice-president for a global non-profit FIGT.org, and the local Finnish American Chamber of Commerce in NYC. I led the Chatham High School Marching Band Club, a registered 501c3, as President for several years. As a leader, I am driven by my values to make a difference by strengthening communities through engagement. In all my leadership experiences, I have improved the performance and structure of the board‚ÄîI am a skilled organizer known for getting things done. I lead with a strong vision and clear goals while building engagement and motivation through communication and relationship building. Want to learn more about working with me as your executive or team coach and facilitator? Send me a note!
